Summary: I reserved our room here because of the high ratings this hotel had and the pictures of their buffet line . Boy was that a mistake!  We were first put into a room just off the pool on the the first floor. The light blared into the room because we couldn’t shut the curtains. The room smelled like cat pee, the room had mold all over, the wall paper was pealing, the shower rod was half torn out of the wall so the curtain wouldn’t stay shut, the tub faucet was not sealed. AND THE BEDS ARE THE MOST UNCOMFORTABLE AND SMALL BEDS EVER! It’s like lying on a board.   Our next room was upstairs which had a balcony. The a/c didn’t work, the door didn’t shut right and looked like it was broken into as the chain lock was half torn off. There was a small amount of mold in this bathroom. This
Manager Response: none

Summary: I chose this hotel because it was pretty close to Disneyland. The photos seemed nice until to you arrive. It is next to a noisy freeway and  industrial area. It is defiantly not a family friendly stay or safe outside of your room at night. The hotel itself was dated. The man who greeted us that night while I juggle my tired and sleepy toddler was less than enthused about his job-which made for a great first impression. I was told my card would not be charged until I arrived at the location and checked in. My card was charged 236 initially for the stay-I did not authorize this transaction. That was not as big as a deal as I was planning on staying there that evening after an EPIC Disney trip. I was advised I needed to place a 200 deposit for my 5 hour stay in case I decided to
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here to be close to downtown Fullerton for a birthday celebration.  The rooms are nice and clean.  Service at the front desk is efficient and friendly.  The free breakfast buffet was a good bonus!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Comfortable stay, friendly and helpful staff
Summary: Stayed one night with my husband to take care of some business.  We arrived at 7:30pm tired after several hours of driving.  The check in was quick and staff was friendly and helpful.  There are stairs and an elevator to get to higher floors.  You have to exit the building to an open air hallway to get to the rooms.  I was able to get extra pillows when requested.  The room was basic but comfortable.  The mattress was firmer than I prefer but we had a good sleep.  The hotel is next to the freeway and I was grateful the air conditioner unit in the room created enough noise to block the sound of traffic.  The swimming pool and exercise room looked inviting but I didn’t have time to use them.  The breakfast platter was generous with scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, hash browns, a
Manager Response: none

Summary: We visited this hotel because all the hotels close to Disneyland were booked.  The Hotel Fullerton advertises free shuttle rides to Disneyland, what they don't tell you until check-in is you must make appointments AND it doesn't run from 2 to 6.  We ended up having to drive on our own to the park two of the three days there.    The shuttle ride back was a little interesting. The shuttle sounded like it was going to fall apart.  I noticed one of the latches for an emergency exit was unlatched and some of the molding in the shuttle was coming off.   The rooms were newly remodeled and pleasantly nice.  We were surprised that they were really spacious for the standard size rooms.   We liked how clean the hotel room was.  There was a little patchwork that needed to be done on the
Manager Response: none

Summary: We really enjoy staying at the Hotel Fullerton. It is a very nice hotel, comfortable rooms, and good breakfast. There is a shuttle that takes you back and forth to Disneyland, which is nice you don't have to worry about driving and parking.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great stay, we arrived late at night and they had our room ready. Breakfast was delicious.. shuttle to Disneyland was great. Beds were very comfortable. Shower had great pressure. Staff was very friendly. We will be back for sure!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Things don’t work. Floor light, room safe, soap dispenser broken. Restaurant was just ok. At 1:45 pm room still not cleaned and had to request it be cleaned.  I guess it’s adequate but far from stellar.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is a perfectly acceptable place for a Disneyland trip provided you’re willing to accept a few quirks.  The Good:  Lots of free parking  Really good breakfast with lots of options  Massive pool, one of the biggest I’ve seen in a hotel  Lots of TV channel options  The Meh:  Room location is critical.  Rooms facing the road are incredibly loud.  Ask for a room facing the pool area where road noise isn’t a problem  Shuttle is a nice option, but times are quite limited.  Expect to potentially supplement with some Uber/Lyft rides especially if you want to come back in the afternoon with little kids  Location is pretty limited.  Expect to drive 5-10 minutes for decent restaurants and services  Beds are a bit firm.  Could be a plus for some people but for those who like softer may
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed 11 nights from mid-Dec to Xmas Day.  Fortunately room was ready upon checkin after 18-hrs flight & about an hour’s drive from LAX airport.  We booked the room with double twin beds for a family of 2 adults and 2 children, but the beds were a bit small.  No in room safe and no complimentary bottled water.  The housekeeping was very poor. Between the 11 nights, more than half the time only 3 bath towels were provided.   This was DESPITE that we left a NOTE EVERYDAY (and a small tip) REMINDING that we NEEDED 4 towels! Also, there were 2 days when there were NO bath towels provided!!  And 1 day when the room was not tidied!!!  It got to a point that we felt consigned to the very poor housekeeping service.  As our itinerary was packed, we didn’t want to waste our time shifting
Manager Response: Dear FrancisSingapore,  We’re sorry to hear that your stay didn’t go as smoothly as expected. We wanted to address some points to bring clarification to what may have occurred during your stay and provide some insight.  In regards to the safe missing from the sleeping room, one of our upcoming projects entails placing new safes for all rooms that are located in the main building. Our Tower building has them already. When it comes to the towels, we apologize that not having enough brought some inconvenience to your stay. We understand that we can do better and see that it brought a sense of frustration. As far as the note/tip goes, our housekeeping team did not seem to understand it or see it. The one day that your room was not serviced, it was noted on our records that a “Do Not Disturb” sign was placed on your door. It is our policy to notate this information from each room daily. Hopefully this will help explain why your room wasn’t tidied up on one of the days. However there’s no excuse for not accommodating your simple request regarding the towels and we’ll certainly address it. We noticed that the rest of the amenities and services were enjoyable. We hope that you change your mind and give us another try when you’re back in the area as we’d hate to see one issue out of the many perks we provide to make the ultimate decision. We’re confident you’ll have a smoother experience the next time around.

Summary: Stay for several nights at The Hotel Fullerton Anaheim and it was an amazing stay. The stay is very helpful and the bed is very comfortable. I believe this is a 3-star hotel, but they sure provide a 4-star service. The hotel is nicely decorated and very clean, which is highly appreciated. Is a short drive from Disneyland so it is very convenient. They have a nice restaurant inside the property as well.
Manager Response: What a great review to read! We truly do appreciate you taking time to share your thoughts with the community here. On behalf of the entire team, thank you again. We hope to see you very soon. Be well!, and be well.

Summary: This property is in a good location right off the highway.  The room was clean, the bed was comfortable.  The free breakfast was also very good with a large selection that was served buffet style and there was free parking.  The bathroom needed some TLC as the water pressure was poor, there was wallpaper peeling off the wall by the bathtub and there were old/worn fixtures in the bathtub. The internet was also slow and kept stopping and starting.
Manager Response: We apologize for falling short of your expectations.  We truly do appreciate you taking time to share your thoughts with the community here. On behalf of the entire team, thank you again. We hope to see you very soon. Be well!, and be well.

Summary Heading: Stayed during a father and daughters trip to Disneyland
Summary: The hotel was pretty clean, the rooms are OK and fairly confortable,   Breakfast is really good,   Shuttle to Disneyland did not run all day, and on weekends when Disneyland closes at 12:00 pm their last shuttle runs at 11:00 pm  The  Shuttle does come on handy of you are going to downtown Disney, where park closing time is less of an issue.   Staff both at the front desk and at the breakfast bar were great

Summary Heading: Great Hotel with Major Letdown for Parents
Summary: My wife made a reservation online last week. She called shortly after follow up with a request for a crib for our daughter who just turned one yesterday. This hotel is much nicer than what we saw online and were pleasantly surprised when we arrived. Once we arrived, we were told that we couldn’t check in to our room yet that was supposed to have two beds: one for our son, one for my wife and I, and a crib for our daughter. We were offered a room instead with one king bed instead. We didn’t have a choice but to take their offer since we were leaving to Disneyland on their shuttle shortly after that and needed to put our things in the room and go. I highly recommend their shuttle service. It’s very convenient and easy to get to Disneyland and is a very good option for families,

Summary: We stayed at this hotel as a blocked room for a wedding and I was pleasantly surprised. This was a very quaint hotel despite being right off the freeway. The room set up is a bit confusing but I take it front desk knows that and were really helpful with directions. Overall very happy with our brief stay.
Manager Response: What a great review to read! We truly do appreciate you taking time to share your thoughts with the community here. On behalf of the entire team, thank you again. We hope to see you very soon. Be well!, and be well.

Summary: This hotel is absolutely beautiful. Upon arriving you may be concerned with the area around the hotel. However, this hotel is extremely safe and absolutely beautiful! The staff were extremely friendly and the pool was fantastic! They do have a park shuttle outside the hotel but we did not utilize it. The breakfast buffet is absolutely DELICIOUS! I cannot express that enough. So why give it 4 stars if its so amazing? I have one complaint. The beds. They were doubles rather than queens which made sleeping two to a bed very difficult. In addition, the bedding was..scratchy is the only way I can describe it. Still, if they upgraded to queen beds we would absolutely stay here again. I definitely recommend.
Manager Response: What a great review to read, although I am sorry that we fell short on the beds. We truly do appreciate you taking time to share your thoughts with the community here. On behalf of the entire team, thank you again. We hope to see you very soon. Be well!, and be well.

Summary Heading: Hotel is tired, and the staff are too
Summary: We stayed here as part of a business trip in September.   Rooms - 2/5 - aircon made me sick- change your filters guys!  Breakfast 2/5 - poor quality, coffee that had no taste  Service 3/5 - read my below dinner experience   Facilities 3/5 - the saviour was the reasonable gym. I chose not to use the pool.   Below is my restaurant experience, and a prime reason why we will not visit again.   How one could get something so wrong when you are talking about a charcuterie board, is honestly beyond me.   Food that took 20+ minutes to arrive when the restaurant was less than 15% full also baffled me, given it was a Sunday evening  Fortunately for me my food was a cold dish. My colleagues waited an additional 10 mins for their food to arrive  Truffle fries - an interesting concept.

Summary Heading: The Hotel is tired...but so was I!
Summary: The lobby is nice, clean and has a refreshing water container filled with fruit.  After receiving the room key, the adventure began...But first, a disclosure: 1) I didn’t complain to the front desk about ANY of the issues I’m about to raise. Most were too small to request a room change, but big enough to make me less comfortable.  This hotel is a maze of rooms, and we walked a great distance to find ours.  The carpeted walkways were threadbare.  The elevator took us to the correct floor but we had to walk down multiple halls through heavy doors, all dragging our luggage. Not a big deal, but when you're tired, it's a trek. In the room, a few things bothered me. In the bathroom, the sink was mostly clean.  The handles and spout were crusted at the base as if they'd not been deep

Summary Heading: Short Stay with family near Disneyland.
Summary: We stayed at this hotel for two night. Good location, breakfast, and free shuttle bus to Disney. Shuttle bus have to be book in advance. Over all Hotel Fullerton is family friendly, and worth the money. Rooms were spot cleaned. Free Buffet breakfast for Guest. Not many option in breakfast. 4* hotel and no free complimentary water. i ask for good view but i got road facing ground floor room. With no view. Ample Parking available with extra charge. Safe box not available in room.

Summary: The staff was very nice. The hotel was very clean. They have a breakfast buffet for guests at the hotel. They have a shuttle to disneyland you need to reserve your shuttle times for disneyland when you check in .the hotel has a pool the pictures are from the pool.

Summary Heading: Great location for Disney & Knott’s Farm
Summary: We stayed here for a few nights. The location is great for visiting Disney. It’s about a 15 minute drive through very quiet back streets.  As a family of four, the room was very comfy. We found the shower very dated though and not the best.   Disappointingly breakfast is only served until 9am on week days. This is great if you are on business, however for a family vacation, where you stay in the Disney parks until midnight, there is no way of making breakfast!! So we missed it a few times :(  Also there are no safes in the rooms. Reception have boxes where you can store your important documents, however this is quiet inconvenient.  This is why I’m only giving 3 out of 5.... if they made breakfast later, sorted the showers out and put in safes... then I would have made it a 5!
Manager Response: Our sincere apologies for the experience you recently had with us. Summary Heading: Great Place - Good Location - Amazing Breakfast Buffet
Summary: We stayed here the night before the CHOC Walk in the Park and just needed a clean bed and a place for an afternoon swim when we took  break from Disneyland.  This hotel really exceeded my expectations.  The room rate was very reasonable.  The room was clean and comfortable with a refrigerator and coffee maker.  (The coffee wasn't all that great, but that's not a big thing.)  The swimming pool was beautiful and the whirlpool was great.  We had to be up and out at 4:30 for our walk, but we were back in time to enjoy the really bountiful breakfast spread.  This was not your usual complimentary breakfast.  There was wait service to clear the dishes and a maitre d' to seat you.  There were two kinds of eggs, bacon, sausage, a waffle station, assorted pastries, potatoes, luscious
Manager Response: What a great review to read! We truly do appreciate you taking time to share your thoughts with the community here. On behalf of the entire team, thank you again. We hope to see you very soon. Be well!, and be well.

Summary: This Hotel was the 4th Hotel we had stayed in this Holiday and I was not disappointed, it was the best.  We checked into room 280 for 3 nights, it was quite large, very clean and a very comfortable bed and quiet.  Breakfast was free with our booking and was always busy, they organised the seating well and the food was lovely, lots of choices.  Restaurant was great for dinner, could not complain of anything, service was great. Out door pool was good, free parking, free wifi.  I would recommend staying here, I definitely would book here again.
Manager Response: What a great review to read! We truly do appreciate you taking time to share your thoughts with the community here. On behalf of the entire team, thank you again. We hope to see you very soon. Be well!, and be well.

Summary: This was our 2nd stay at this hotel. We come to Disney once a year and have enjoyed both our stays at this hotel. Always clean and safe. Staff is friendly and breakfast is delicious. This time we used the shuttle to go to DL and it worked just fine and saved us $$$$. Although the hotel is several miles away from DL, its worth it. Hotels on Harbour Blvd are pretty disgusting and expensive. This has become our go to hotel for our Cali trips.
Manager Response: What a great review to read! We truly do appreciate you taking time to share your thoughts with the community here. On behalf of the entire team, thank you again. We hope to see you very soon. Be well!, and be well.

Summary: Arriving at different times, allowed my daughter to have an early check in. Room comfortable with enough space for three adults. Room cleaned every day. Public spaces clean and airy. Pool small but never used. Clean towels every day. Buffet breakfast included, could have provided more granola dishes in fridge and No pancakes !!! If you were down after half eight very little left ! Too many eggs !! Location fine if going to Disney as offer shuttle buses. To get to downtown LA need to get to train station, train prices both metro and MATRAk very expensive. Chose to drive after the first day.  All in all a decent hotel, located in a commercial area. Wouldn't advise to use unless you plan to drive.
Manager Response: Thank you for the review.  Please do come and visit us again soon.  Be well!

Summary: The Hotel Fullerton is really conveniently located about 15 minutes drive from Disneyland and an hour or so from Universal. We had rented a car so getting around from here was great.  The room itself was large and quite spacious. The beds were comfortable and the room had air conditioning, so we had absolutely no trouble with the outside temperature!   The in-room facilities included a large TV, ironing board, wardrobe and fridge. The bedside table had a USB charging power point which was hugely convenient as I didn't remember an adaptor. For the price of the hotel I personally found this quite a generous offering. It would have been useful to have a deposit box or safe, and some of the drawers under the TV were wonky and so did not open (although we didn't want to use them

Summary: This has got to rate as one of the worst places I have ever stayed. It was truly the motel from hell.  I was in the Fullerton/Anaheim area on business. I checked into the hotel. First, the person who greeted me at the desk was efficient but not particularly friendly.  Most of the other personnel tried hard, but the problem with this place is that there were so many systemic problems and issues that it was truly a horrible experience. First, it is important to know that this motel caters primarily to large tours and tourists (unfortunately I was not aware of this) who are from other countries and who are staying there while they attend Disneyland. So, the mindset of the management is one of treating people less as individuals and more on a mass level. At least twice a day, large
Manager Response: We are sorry to hear about your recent experience with our hotel.  In conference with the number of staff members that you encountered during your stay with us, we feel that every effort was made to rectify the issues and ease your concerns that you had.  We regret to hear that you were still largely unsatisfied after these efforts were made.  We wish you safe travels in the future.  Be well.

Summary: We stayed 6 days at this property and absolutely enjoyed it. Yes it’s an older property and yes it needs remolding but it’s clean and has excellent customer service. They have plenty of FREE parking spaces and FREE breakfast. Most of the hotels charge for both. We were really impressed with the complementary breakfast, as it had plenty of options to choose from. The hotel is situated in a perfect location and it’s very close to the highway. Also, if you drive around a bit, there’s plenty of spaces to eat and shop. We totally recommend this hotel and will definitely stay here again.

Summary: I super love this hotel. It was unfortunate that we arrived around dinner time and had to get picked up by the bus tour at 630am. They had a wide range of choices for breakfast, the room was comfy and wide enough... I loved the design of the hotel. The WiFi was great as well.

Summary: Overall I was pleased with this hotel!! I was able to check in a little early coming from Phoenix before heading to the beach. I was glad to drop everything off. It was clean! The shower was great!! The amenities in the room were better than expected, including an iron, ironing board, blow dryer, mini fridge, coffee maker and dispensers in the shower. The hotel itself was nice and clean as well. I loved having a shuttle to Disneyland!! The vending machines were a little overpriced. A can of Pepsi, which I needed since Disneyland only offers Coke, was $1.75. The breakfast was great!! My daughters loved the food!! The room was nice, clean and roomy!! We liked all the available outlets for USB.  We didn’t go in the pool or hot tub because we were at Disneyland til late.  My only

Summary: Our family of six Stayed at the hotel Fullerton for four nights, two adjoining rooms. Great staff nice clean hotel. Good location. Shuttle to and from the parks daily various times. Really good buffet breakfast each morning.

Summary: We chose this hotel for our stay while we were going to be visiting Disneyland because price wise it was a little cheaper than the hotels closer to Disney and they still offered a shuttle. We already had an online reservation so check in process was quick and the shuttle has to be scheduled so upon arrival I scheduled the shuttle for the next day. The room was comfortable and very clean. Breakfast was great, hot buffet is always a plus. You can chose to be seated or you can ask for a to go box which is nice when you do not want to sit in the dining area but obviously you'll have more options or you can eat more if you dine in. My only complaint is that the shuttle had to be scheduled it does not run every 30 mins or so like ART. The ride is only about 15 min to/from Disney so
Manager Response: We greatly appreciate the review and the kind words you have about your experience here during your recent stay with us. Summary: We were there for multiple days. The room was comfortable and there were multiple charging outlets for our devices.  The breakfast buffet was very good and the waitstaff was personable and had a wonderful sense of humor.  My only complaint would be the water faucet selector and the shower-head. Both should be replaced .

Summary: My husband and I were in Anaheim for business and stayed at The Hotel Fullerton.  From the numerous times I called them with questions before our stay, to the time of checking in and the balance of our time there, I cannot compliment them enough.  Everyone working the front desk was polite, professional and friendly.  Our room was very clean, in perfect order and amazingly quiet.  We live on a busy street and are very familiar with trying to sleep through traffic noise, and were so pleased to have 3 very quiet nights at this hotel.  Girls, the bathroom lighting and position of the mirror made it easy to get ready in the morning!  The beds, pillows and all bedding was soft and really comfortable.  For relaxing after a long day, the TV had a nice channel selection and good volume

Summary: I thought the front desk staff was incredibly kind and I slept amazing. But, I was working at a very large conference at the convention center and knew I wasn't going to be able to watch my things closely so thought it would be safer to leave things in the room. Wrong choice. I tucked a $250 gift card in my work back up on the shelf of the closet and it was taken.  An iPad went missing from my co-workers room the same week.  I double and triple checked everywhere because I didn't want to believe it. I hope whoever took it needed it more than me. What makes me the most upset is that I have called 3 times - once I spoke with the Manager who said he would get back to me and twice I was asked to leave a message. I have yet to hear from anyone from the hotel. It has been over a
Manager Response: We're sorry to hear that you're still upset over the loss of the gift card. In regards to your stay, we have noted that you have already spoken to our manager Alex. He has also confirmed the conversation. We understand your frustration, but please know we have a very strict policy that is enforced in regards to our guests personal belongings. We also have records of who enters our guest rooms and when. As such, our team is very aware that they would be investigated should ever a guest make a strong claim. It is not something that is taken lightly. The majority of the time, guests that have claimed that an item has gone missing, comes back or calls to advise that they have found the item after all. Unfortunately, we were not able to locate your card after it went missing, but we are very certain that if it were to have been found, our team members would have turned it in. Found items are also inputted into our system should a guest inquire about them once they check-out. We truly apologize for what occurred and recommend using the safe in the room for valuable items. If ever you require additional storage for valuable items, we also have it available at the front desk. We hope that you allow us the opportunity to have you with us for the next time you return for the conference.

Summary: This is a really good hotel, with friendly and helpful staff, the rooms are spacious, with coffee making equipment, fridge and tv. There's a Fitness area and a large pool area. The breakfast, that was included in my booking, is buffet style, with a choice of cereals and a selection of hot items, bacon, eggs, sausages etc, really good value. The only small downside to this hotel, is, it is quite close to a freeway and in some areas, the noise can be heard in the rooms, through the night.
Manager Response: We greatly appreciate the review and the kind words you have about your experience here during your recent stay with us. The refrigerator froze everything I put in it (there was no option to adjust the temp.) Total smoke free hotel... however every time I left my room the smell of smoke was ever present. Lots of burns in the carpet of my room. The rooms are outdated. It looks like they spent a lot on outside renovations but the rooms are in need of serious help. Breakfast staff was very rude to me when I showed up at 8:50. They close at 9 but the email I got from the hotel stated breakfast was served til 10. I had to refer to the email because there was no information in the room about anything. They supposedly offer

Summary: I truly loved this place. It was affordable and really nice. I even messed up my reservation and they helped me upgrade my room without skipping a beat, even though they were booked pretty solid. My room was very clean and comfortable and all of the staff were more than helpful with everything I needed throughout my stay. I had questions they promptly answered and dealt with in a most professional manner. I don't know what to say other than I know where I'll be staying for all my future trips to the greater Los Angeles area. They have earned a customer for life.

Summary: I had a meeting at Cal State Fullerton and usually stay at the Marriott across the street. It was fully booked so I tried the Hotel Fullerton. It was a pleasant surprise. The hotel staff, especially at the front desk, were very cordial and inviting. The rooms were comfortable and clean. I didn't have a chance to eat breakfast so I can't comment on that.

Summary: People are nice.  Breakfast was delicious and a good start to our busy days!! Rooms clean and beds so comfortable!  Great trip .. All the staff were pleasant and Rommel was so sweet and accommodating! It’s nice that they cared enough to check on us often!!
Manager Response: What a great review to read! We truly do appreciate you taking time to share your thoughts with the community here. On behalf of the entire team, thank you again. We hope to see you very soon. Be well!, and be well.

Summary Heading: Kudos to Manager Alex De La Serna.
Summary: We were very happy to have met the hotel manager of the day - Mr. Alex De La Serna. He was super friendly and helpful to us and an overall great example of Filipino Hospitality. Thank you for helping make our stay a pleasant one.
Manager Response: What a great review to read! We truly do appreciate you taking time to share your thoughts with the community here. We are especially happy to hear that Alex was able to personally attend to your needs during your recent stay with us. We will be sure to share your kind words with him. On behalf of the entire team, thank you again. We hope to see you very soon. Be well!, and be well.

Summary: Hotel Fullerton is beautiful from the outside. The pictures are lovely, but not worth money that was spent. Over priced typical buffet breakfast, muffins, danishes, over cooked eggs, and waffles. Not $18 per person worth.   Beds are worn out, dipped in the middle, uncomfortable for 2 adults.   Rooms were spot cleaned, we had another guest undergarment and house slippers in our room. Makes you wonder if the sheets were changed cleaned?   The bathroom was super small, could not shut the door without straddling the toilet or standing in the corner of that bathroom. Shower faucet handle was broken and the conditoner dispenser was broken.   BEST PART OF ALL.....we offer shuttle service to and from Disneyland. Biggest reason we stayed here. Yes, they offer shuttle service....first
Manager Response: Our sincere apologies for the experience you recently had with us. We always strive to go above and beyond our guests expectations, and it appears we fell quite short in this instance. We will use your feedback in an effort to improve our service going forward. We do hope you all afford us another opportunity to make it up to you. Thank you and be well.

Summary: Hotel is old but functional.  The hotel is spread out in several connected blocks.  Finding the room for the first time was confusing.   We booked a room for 4 pax but were provided 3 sets of towels.  Housekeeping was quick to deliver the remaining towels.  The air-con/heater in the room was so so noisy.  The noise disturbed our sleep.  We can't switch it off because it would be too cold in the room.  Breakfast was the usual fare with 1 manager/waiter occasionally reminding guests to tip.  The free shuttle service to and fro Disneyland was rapidly booked so we did not have our preferred time.   To summarise, it was a disappointment.
Manager Response: Our sincere apologies for the experience you recently had with us. We always strive to go above and beyond our guests expectations, and it appears we fell quite short in this instance. We will use your feedback in an effort to improve our service going forward. We do hope you all afford us another opportunity to make it up to you. Thank you and be well.

Summary Heading: Very nice hotel close to Disneyland with wonderful friendly reception team.
Summary: Stayed in this hotel particularly for the location. Closer to Disney but on a smaller budget. This was a beautiful hotel particularly from the outside, with a big outdoor pool and jacuzzi (although we had no time to use them)  It provides free shuttle to and from the park although I must specify you have to book this at best a few days in advance as spaces are very limited particularly at buser times.  Breakfast buffet was included in our booking although it was very basic,options are limited and some things I would have liked to have eaten had ran out on all three mornings we were there.   Something we found odd was that a bath plug(tub stopper I've now found out in America) was not provided. When we asked the next morning they said they don't provide them because parents leave
Manager Response: We greatly appreciate the review and the kind words you have about your experience here during your recent stay with us. We make our best effort to ensure that our guests leave here feeling better than when they arrived, and in this case it appears were able to accomplish that! We wanted to say thank you for staying with us, and we hope that we will see you again in the near future. Thank you, and be well.

Summary: My daughter's volleyball team stayed at this hotel, so we booked it as well. I didn't know what to expect as I had not googled it prior. When we drove here, there was nothing around except industrial business buildings, a truck yard, rail road tracks, etc. When we drove up and actually walked in, it was like an oasis!! The hotel was clean, courtyard was nice with a pool and gazebo. There was even a wedding going on. Check in was easy and the customer service was great. I worked out both nights at their gym, which is open 24 hours a day, and it was nice. Not too many items, but since I was the only one there it was awesome! 2 treadmills, 2 elliptical machines, dumbbells, 1 bike and a weight machine. Our room was nice with 2 doubles and a fridge. It was large which we liked. We

Summary: The room was clean, little on the small side, but comfortable. Desk and chair. Refrigerator. Staff friendly. Got a better rate through Expedia than directly through them. Their restaurant had limited menu but good food. Free WiFi. Breakfast included with our room rate.

Summary: A huge hotel,the rooms are large to accommodate 4 adults.Check in is fast and at peak times can get busy as plenty of tour companies use this hotel for their tours.The breakfast room is small really tiny compared to the size of the Hotel.Often there is a line of people waiting to get in.On one occasion they had to open an adjoining room to accommodate the overspill of guests.For vegetarians,the breakfast spread is very poor, not worth the time spent lining up. Apart from the sugary cereals, the variety and quality of bread and fresh fruits is below par,staff is swept off their feet and have no time to help or assist.The price of the room is competitive,which is the saving grace

Summary Heading: they love unauthorized credit card charges, were not the only ones
Summary: We stayed at this hotel for two nights in December.  It was at best a mediocre hotel with outdated room décor, not so great beds, and we found a dead bug in the bathtub upon arrival.  The only positive aspect of this place was the location, breakfast was good, and it is a ten minute drive to Disney which is the why we booked it.  The main reason I wanted to review this hotel is they attempted, not one, but two fraudulent charges on my credit card.  One they claimed was a “double billing” mistake that I had to ask to be removed, which they did, and the other a charge for soiled towels.  They claimed housekeeping found stains on the towels when we checked out which was not true in any way. I filed a chargeback with my credit card company to recover this, second, fraudulent charge.
Manager Response: Our sincere apologies for the experience you recently had with us. We always strive to go above and beyond our guests expectations, and it appears we fell quite short in this instance. We will use your feedback in an effort to improve our service going forward. Summary Heading: Decent hotel, good price, stayed here for Disneyland
Summary: The hotel is very nice and clean and we liked our room. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I lost our breakfast tickets on the first day and they replaced them with no problem. We stayed here 2 days while going to Disneyland and we arrived in the middle of the night and they cancelled our room because they thought we weren't going to show up. They re-booked our room with no problem but I would have been very upset if they were sold out and we had no where to stay. Overall we had a good experience and the breakfast was really good, the only reason why I wouldn't stay here again is because of the infrequent shuttle rides to Disneyland. We missed one and the next one wasn't coming for another 2 hours so we ended up driving to the park everyday. It's about a 30 min drive so
Manager Response: Our sincere apologies for the experience you recently had with us. Summary: We stayed here for a few days - whilst the outside looks very nice, the room were ok ok, they were a bit small. However what disappointed me was the breakfast. On the first day we reached the breakfast hall at 8:30 expecting to eat, however there was a long queue and took us 20 mins to get seated. Then once we were seated, the restaurant managed started telling everyone rudely - the kitchen is closing, eat fast and rushed everyone out. The restaurant managed was rude to everyone. On the second day we reached well on time around 7:30 - so again we had to wait 20 or so minutes to be seated. Once seated - we went to get the bread to make toast, and guess what - all the bread has finished. I asked if they had more bread and the same managed said rudely its finished - what is there

Summary: I booked my hotel stay through travelzoo and saw a charge for three nights on my credit card upon booking. When I checked in they confirmed that the room had already been paid for and when I checked out my balance was zero.  When credit card was used to pay for the rooms and another credit card was loose for the deposit. Three weeks later I see a charge of $50 on one credit card and $100 on another credit card. When I called the hotel Omar told me that I was never charged for the room and they are collecting money for the nights I had stayed.  Completely unacceptable and unauthorized charges on both cards. Banks have been called to report fraudulent charges
Manager Response: We're sorry that you didn't want us to charge your cards for your stay with us, but while reconciling we found that you were never charged for your reservation. We apologize that we didn't catch this sooner and that incorrect information was provided to you about payment on your reservation during your stay. However, we are authorized to charge for your reservation since you were a guest at the hotel. Please double check your statement, you'll see that you were never charged until now by the hotel or Travelzoo. Travelzoo does not charge for reservations booked at our hotel. Your bank will be able to advise you on this and we'll certainly address all details required for your bank as well. Once again, we're sorry for any confusion, but we wanted to clear up the situation so that you understand what occurred.

Summary: We arrived on the 27th of November after a very long journey and flight of 16 hours. We were greeted by friendly reception staff and offered cold drinks. Our room was 204 which comprised of 2 double beds , t.v., fridge , coffee maker and ensuite bathroom with toiletries. Our room was spacious and exceptionally clean. The power shower certainly eased all our aches and pains after travelling. We thoroughly enjoyed the complimentary  breakfast every day. There was such a great variety of choice. The swimming pool was  idyllic too . We found this hotel to be in a good location right at the side of the Freeway , ideal for exploring other areas. Also nearby were restaurants , bars , shopping. We loved that this hotel provided a shuttle to Disneyland. We stayed for 7 days  and we found
Manager Response: We greatly appreciate the review and the kind words you have about your experience here during your recent stay with us. We make our best effort to ensure that our guests leave here feeling better than when they arrived, and in this case it appears were able to accomplish that! We wanted to say thank you for staying with us, and we hope that we will see you again in the near future. Thank you, and be well.

Summary Heading: A good find for its price
Summary: Stayed here in Nov 2018 for 3 nights for the disneyland. The window of our room is right in front of the parking, so it can be noisy from time to time. Good size room. We were surprised with the breakfast. Lots of varieties to choose from. They offer free shuttle to Disney. Not sure of the frequency as we did not take the shuttle. Parking was free. Friendly staff. We used the self-service laundry, we were charged twice for using the washing machine which only accepts credit card.
Manager Response: Adelyn_lsl,  Thank you for the kind words! We love to hear about our guests experiences at our hotel, and we are pleased you enjoyed our recent stay with us, but are saddened to hear about your bad experience with the room noise and the charges for the self service laundry. We hope that this was resolved for you during your stay.  We do hope you will visit us again soon. Thanks and be well!

Summary: Stayed here for 2 nights we went to Medieval Times one night and Disneyland the next day   The hotel was very nice and clean. Staff very friendly. With your stay there is a free breakfast buffet which has a pretty good variety.   Free shuttle to Disneyland just have to sign up with lobby. The daytime shuttle driver was very polite and drove safely the night time driver on the other hand drove too fast and made us feel unsafe he seemed to be in a rush   Only thing that sucked was the full size beds as most hotels I stay at have queen size and they weren’t too comfortable
Manager Response: missestrange,  Thank you for the kind words! We love to hear about our guests experiences at our hotel, and we are pleased you enjoyed our recent stay with us, but are saddened to hear about your bad experience with the bed in your guest room.  We do hope you will visit us again soon.  Thanks and be well!

Summary: Good night stopover at The Hotel Fullerton. Good choices at the morning buffet breakfast. Room is good with all basic ammenties provided. Very clean and and comfortable beddings. Friendly staff and always feel at home for the night.
Manager Response: ChewMalaysia,  Thank you for the kind words!  We love to hear about our guests experiences at our hotel, and we are pleased you enjoyed our recent stay with us.  Thank you and be well!

Summary: I booked a room online with booking.com because of their reasonable rate. When I arrived to the hotel, they checked us into our room. I had reserved a tower room with a king size bed. Only to find that when we had gotten into our room, they had given us a queen bed even though I have reserved a king.  Husband talked to someone at the front desk and the had told him that the King beds will only be given if they had them available. Even though I had booked months ago with a king bed preference.  Wish they had told me that before I had booked my nonrefundable room.  If your going to stay here,and bed preference matters to you. (It mattered to us because we had  our 3 year old with us) I don't suggest booking here. They didn't seem the least bit concerned with it, nor did they even
Manager Response: Jessica L,  We are sorry to hear about your recent experience with our hotel.  We do make every attempt to accommodate all requests and preferences pre-arrival, but unfortunately there are times where this is not possible.  We appreciate you leaving a review and we will use your comments as a training tool for our entire team.  We hope you will afford us another opportunity to exceed your expectations.  Be well.

Summary: The hotel looks nice. It's in a industrial area and the 91 freeway is across the road. Our room faced the freeway however we didn't hear any freeway noise. The beds were ok. The shower was awful. The water dribbled out with no water pressure. I would have had better luck washing my hair in the sink. It took 50 minutes to get a decent shower because the water pressure was that ridiculous. We got this hotel because it had free parking, breakfast and a free shuttle to Disneyland. All other hotels closer to Disney were about $50 more a night. I would have rather paid more and stayed closer. The Disney shuttle wasn't running. So we had to take an Uber both days which came to about $18 each day. If you're considering this hotel for the shuttle... Don't bother. One day the front desk
Manager Response: Barbara S,  Our sincere apologies for the experience you recently had with us. Summary: They ruined my stay by making a deposit hold mistake on my card initially holding 3 times the amount. That interfered with a bill I had coming out causing a $50 late fee. The hotel promised to call me back to fix it, not only did I not get called back, but Theresa from accounting was rude. Didn't want to help and I kept getting passed around.  Thanks for nothing. Never returning here.

Summary Heading: The Hotel Is FULL of TON of Surprises
Summary: We stayed at the Hotel Fullerton during the last few days of our trip. The front desk staff was open, friendly and had smiles on their faces. They were willing to assist with any questions that I had. I was able to arrange a day trip, via shuttle, to Universal Studios. The room was nice and comfortable. At one point I thought that the thermostat in the room was not functioning because I was unable to adjust the temperature in the room. The front desk clerk was very accommodating and sent the maintenance man to my room. He pointed out that the thermostat was located on the wall, much to my embarrassment. He was not irritated at all that he had to make an unnecessary trip. The hotel  is in a good location near plenty of restaurants and stores. Walmart is nearby and the famous "In

Summary: Our son goes to Fullerton State  and this has been our go to hotel.  It is reasonably priced, clean, and grounds are well maintained.  We always get the buffet breakfast they offer which is very good.  Close  to all freeways and they offer shuttles to Disneyland.

Summary Heading: not friendly staff / not worth your money
Summary: when i first went there person who should be greeting us did not even seem welcoming i thought it was a good place to stay because it had 4 stars but no.... they charge 18 or 19 dollar for breakfast i'm like wow... breakfast they charge a lot not just that people at the desk they did not even give us the password for the wifi so we had to ask random person that stayed in the hotel. The rooms are very stuffy when i got there pillows are very uncomfortable blankets doesn't feel right. it was the worst hotel i ever been to don't waste your money at this hotel go somewhere else it should not be 4 stars it should be 2!  oh also i got there at 6:30pm and they told me if i dont leave by 10:30pm they would charge me for another night. for 2 people it came out total 142 dollar. I would
Manager Response: Hi Susie K, We’re sorry to hear about your experience. It is always our goal to make our guests feel welcome and comfortable upon their arrival. It seems as if we’ve missed the mark on this. We will be addressing this accordingly. If you’re willing to share more details on your booking, we can pinpoint where we can focus our attention. In regards to the breakfast pricing, most of our guests have breakfast included since we are offering a promotion called the Sunny Summer Promo. This promotion also offers a discount off the room rate providing the greatest value when staying with us. When it comes down to our WiFi password, we provide a hotel information sheet upon your arrival that lists out the access code. If this wasn’t communicated to you, we will be certain to do a better job. In regards to leaving by 10:30 pm, we’re not sure what this is in regards to. Our normal check-in time is 3:00pm, while our check-out time is 11:00am. As you can see, we would not have any reason to ask you to leave by 10:30pm. There must be some confusion on this aspect of your stay. We’d love to discuss with you further, if you’re open and willing, as we can be reached at sales@hfulleron.com. We hope to hear from you and apologize that your stay wasn’t as smooth as you had expected. We hope that you allow us the opportunity to make it up to you.

Summary: Good location and they offer a Disney shuttle.  Free WiFi, they have restaurants and bar on property.  Room was dark and comfortable,  including a coffee maker and fridge.  Overall pleased with the property.

Summary: I spent 3 nights here while visiting a friend in Anaheim. The hotel is a typical tourist class hotel that seemed to cater to large groups. It's very family friendly and has a nice pool/jacuzzi, on site restaurant (very good but a little pricey) and a small fitness center. It was a good bargain - I booked through a discount hotel app. The rooms are generous and it's conveniently located close to the local attractions.

Summary: Good place to stay with pool.  Free parking and breakfast.  Rooms are good with a/c.  Downside is that during the free breakfast the bacon and sausage were almost always under cooked.  And if you do leave your Do Not Disturb sign up after housecleaning has come, but leave sometime during the day, be sure to let the front desk know, since housekeeping will not come back to your room and they close up around 6 pm.

Summary: This place is so scary. The room was dirty, smelled like smoke, and had puke outside our door. The elevators smelled rotten. Our curtains had stains. The bed had one sheet that wasn’t fitted with a dirty mattress. These reviews have to be fake on here. Stay away!!!!!!

Summary Heading: Front desk staff is rude and has 0 understanding. Go some where else and get treated better.
Summary: Front desk staff is rude and has 0 understanding. Go somewhere else and get treated way better. We checked in early and no floor rooms were available, mind you the entire place including parking lot is completely empty. No elevators except in main lobby where the weak front desk staff is at, Carlos in particular was rude and short with me.  They put us 3 floors up and way way way way way down toward the end of the hotel. It’s a pain when you have a lot of bags and luggage and you got to go up 3 flights and be very far away from everything. Will not ever come back here again will spend my money else where. I agree with many of the 1 star reviews
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Good hotel but in flux and not sure thats good or bad!
Summary: We have stayed at this hotel probably 3-4 times over the last 10 years.  The hotel is clean and the rooms are large enough.  They had a great amenity for us in that they had an extra table that pulled out and could be used to play cards or store things on.  They also gave us a complimentary breakfast, which we didn't expect but was nice.  The food wasn't anything to wrote home about but free is free!  The staff were all very friendly, professional, and helpful.  They have redecorated the restaurants and all in all the place looks nice and modern.  Once inside the corridor for the rooms things started feeling a bit musty but once in the room with the AC on it went away.   They have a free shuttle to Disneyland, which we didn't use but would be a real plus.  There were many

Summary: My family and I stayed here for 4 nights for a Disneyland trip. We chose this hotel because of the deal we got even though it is a 10-15min drive to Disneyland. Most Anaheim hotels are ridiculously overpriced and not the best quality, but we found this hotel in Fullerton more than suitable. We had no issues getting to DL on time and the hotel even offers a shuttle (we did not use, we like taking Lyfts, about $15 round trip). They had a full hot breakfast buffet included with the room with lots of options for every member of the family. The staff was very friendly and helpful and the rooms were spacious and clean. We heard absolutely no noise at night and were able to sleep soundly. Unfortunately it was too cold to use the pool but it looked clean. The lobby had fresh lemon water

Summary Heading: Yeah, Not a place I would send my clients or friends or even enimies to.
Summary: I was there on saturday 7-29-17, for a travel conference and training. It will, I am sure be a much nicer facade when the construction is completed. Here is what the runners and planners from the Hotel put a group of approximately 300 travel agents through:  1. The sales and promotional department did not inform the attendees of the road construction, preventing access to the hotel from the main street of entry. 2. The hotel did not place any signage at the front desk to assist with the attendees in finding the proper entryway for the event, which was past the front entry and past all the construction and under some of the scaffolding. 3. The Tech person, who was setting up the slide projector and screens was not proficient and the room was not ready for the presenters until 45
Manager Response: none

Summary: We traveled to Fullerton for my daughter’s college graduation. After driving 7 hours, we were told our room wasn’t ready because check in was at 3. We arrived at 2. Another room was offered facing the parking lot, but I had specifically ordered a room overlooking the courtyard. Our “ Courtyatd  View ” was the corner of a hallway that led to the courtyard. Our phone didn’t work. A repairman came and stayed over 30 minutes trying to fix our phone. He got the zero to work. After sweating through the night, we realized our air conditioner didn’t blow cold air. Repairmen looked at it for an hour. We waited 2 hours for a new room to open up. Hotel didn’t offer to move us. The front desk clerks were not organized. They were not friendly or helpful. I had to ask for a map of the

Summary: After having to scramble for a new hotel on a moments notice (see my review of the Embassy Suiets Anaheim North), I was able to book a room at Hotel Fullerton. From the moment I walked in the lobby, I was greeted by a friendly staff, and stylish interior. All of the staff were extremely helpful, especially Michael and Samantha.   My room was in the tower on the 3rd floor overlooking the courtyard and pool. The room itself was clean, stylish, and roomy.  The beds were very comfortable, and I loved the Paya products in the bathroom.   The Citizens Kitchen restaurant was delicious! The cocktails inventive and yummy. I had the Tito’s Ortiz and the pomegranate martini.  The cheese board was tasty, as was the leafy greens salad and grilled asparagus. The sautéed shrimp was yummy too.

Summary: Let me say the hotel is very nice and modern, the staff and employees are very friendly and professional and the onsite restaurant (The Kitchen) has a nice menu and good tasting food. The hotel is a good distance from Disneyland but offers a shuttle to and from the park; unfortunately the shuttle is not very reliable. The shuttle was not available when we wanted/needed it on two of our four days at times we wanted to utilize the shuttle.  Apparently there was a single guest that monopolized the shuttle daily at 4 pm (not even going to or from the resort) and their were occasions there was no one to drive the shuttle “ due to an emergency ”. We choose this facility Because of the advertised shuttle service but had to use Uber and taxis to get to and from the Disneyland resort.

Summary: Had a wonderful stay at the Hotel Fullerton for our trip to Disneyland. Our room with two double beds was very clean and nice, and overlooked the courtyard. We booked through Travelzoo, and the breakfast buffet was included with our room. The buffet included many selections, including delicious waffles, bacon, sausage, scrambled eggs, and much more. The food was very good. The buffet service was wonderful as well. We enjoyed happy hour after our Disneyland visits at the Citizen Restaurant located in the hotel. The food was delicious and the service was excellent. The shuttle service to Disneyland was great. It runs every hour, and you just need to book it one hour in advance. It takes about 15-20 minutes to get to and from Disneyland. Highly recommend this hotel for Disneyland

Summary: Me, my wife and 2 kids have just got back to the UK after spending 2 weeks in this fantastic hotel... Very clean hotel with very  friendly staff, great food and comfy beds. The location of the hotel is great if your planning a Disney / Universal holiday but because of the LA highway system (the most disastrous road system I have ever driven on) it’s a bit far out if your planning numerous trips in the direction of LA LA Land. Having said that the hotel itself is completely faultless except perhaps for the pool being a bit too cold and the spa being a bit too hot. I would like to thank everyone at the hotel for a great 2 weeks and hope to visit again one day...

The outdoor pool looked nice, but we didn't swim in it as it was a little cool outdoors when we visited in February.

Summary: The Hotel Fullerton is located not far from my mother’s house and near many popular attractions including Fullerton’s historic downtown and Fullerton College. Unfortunately it’s located next to the super busy 91 freeway. So this past visit we tried to find the quietest room. After checking out three rooms we chose one that faced north in the tower overlooking the parking lot. Unfortunately tour buses unload passengers there and people are walking back and forth to their cars. Nonetheless it was better than southfacing rooms. The hotel’s amenities improved since the last time we stayed here. Make sure you’re in the breakfast room before closing time as I missed it by a few minutes and found the door locked. Carlos and Destiny at the front desk were very helpful and accommodating!

Summary Heading: Disneyland Trip for a Senior Couple
Summary: My husband and I decided to celebrate my retirement and his birthday with a trip to Disneyland.  After a lot of research and reading a lot of reviews, we chose the Hotel Fullerton for its price, free shuttle and breakfast.  We stayed for 4 nights. This hotel grew on my. As a tired traveler, I was unsure at first. It was a bit noisy the first night and my first impression was put off a bit by loud guests and seemingly sterile environment. Waking up to the best hotel breakfast that I have ever had and coming back to the cleanest room ever, changed my opinion.  The hotel runs under very strict standards, they know their business and work hard to to be efficient and helpful. The housekeeping staff, who I never saw, did an impeccable job with our room. Summary Heading: Very nice hotel close to Disneyland
Summary: The hotel staff was very accommodating and friendly from the moment we walked into the hotel. We were able to check in prior to going to Disneyland for the day and we were even able to take the shuttle right after checking in. The breakfast was much better than all the breakfasts around the park for the same price. We took a Lyft ride home each night as it was easier than waiting for the shuttle which you can schedule at the top of the hour for pick up. The Lyft ride was $9 back to the hotel. The bottom of the shower tub needed a quick wipe down when we got into the room but that was really the only issue we had the whole time we were there.

Summary: We stayed here for a week while visiting Disneyland for a few days and checking out the surrounding attractions. The location was great, closed to freeway so easy accessible to other attractions. The staffs were friendly and the lobby looks elegant. It’s a fairly large hotel, they have meeting spaces and an onsite restaurant. They do hold a $100 incidental charge at check in and will be refunded back a few days after check out. The amenities onsite were good (coin laundry, gym, pool). They also had free shuttle to Disneyland, but we didn’t use it due to the fact that it is on reservation basis, so it wouldn’t work if we want to stay longer or come back to the hotel earlier. But if your schedule is pretty set, the free shuttle service can save you $20/day parking at Disneyland.

The free breakfast is one the better ones I've had at a hotel in a long time. If you drive to Disneyland from the hotel it is about 15 minutes. They also have a restaurant and bar on site.

They do give you voucher for breakfast, but the food is subpar, save your calories at the Parks or somewhere else.  The food were cold and bacon looked like it wasn't cooked all the way.  They also host a lot of tour groups, it was interesting to see people hang their laundry by the pool.  They do have a business center that you're free to use, that was nice. Shuttle service was very clean and spacious. One of us dropped our wallet in the shuttle and didn't even know til we checked  out and flew back home! They found it, saw the name, and called us right away and we got it safe and sound! Excellent customer service. Thanks a million to Alex! And Crystal :)  The free breakfast buffet was decent.
