After a few hiccups I was able to enjoy the hotel the room was clean and spacious.The pool was a clean and decent size we would really consider this
Manager Response: "Family Hotel" Thank you for your kind review. I am happy to report that this problem is resolved.  If you have a reservation, arrive early and we have an empty room we will accommodate your check in without question. We understand how unpredictable travel can be and are here to accommodate. If any guest experiences a similar problem please feel free to contact me on my cell 24 hours a day for an immediate solution. 310 935 6339.  Thank you "Family Hotel" for your support. Look for the Crowne Plaza Fullerton-Anaheim when you return where we look forward to checking you in any time of the day. Tommy

Summary: This past Christmas we wanted to take a family trip to Disneyland. Pricing hotels in & around the park were pricy!! Accidently, I came across "The Hotel Fullerton." After talking to the VERY nice & courteous front desk woman we decided to book with them. Not only did she reserve our room but also took care of getting us extra tickets to BOTH Disney Theme Parks at a low rate and had them delivered to our room upon arrival. Checking in was EASY & FAST. We even got an unexpected room upgrade! Shuttle to the parks was fast and reliable throughout the day & evening (Just remember to book em with front desk!) Also, our family received free breakfasts that were actually very tasty & convenient  before leaving each morning! The internet service was "Lagging" but the free "Starbucks" in
Manager Response: "Great Place for Families" You really know how to make our day! Thanks a Million! We appreciate you review very much. I will print and share it with my entire team right away. Your review is fantastic and very nice to read. We will continue to strive for your satisfaction and will shoot for a repeat performance when you return. Remember to look for the Crowne Plaza Fullerton-Anaheim. Anyone wanting to book The Hotel Fullerton after May 1st should look for the Crowne Plaza Fullerton-Anaheim instead. Thanks again "Great Place for Families" and remember to try our sparkling pool, hot tub and of course our full service Bar Griswold's when you return. Tommy

Summary: We just had a great trip to Disneyland.  The prices of the hotels directly across the street from Disney, were expensive.  Not only were the regular rates really reasonable, but they had a special on Groupon, which could not be beat!   The hotel was very clean and the staff was friendly,  The rooms were a nice size with comfortable beds and super cozy pillows.  They have dining (with good selections) right in the hotel and a heated pool.  This hotel offers shuttle service to and from Disney, which is only a little over 3 miles away.  We had no complaints about this hotel.
Manager Response: "A great hotel for Disneyland" I cannot thank you enough for this review. We will share and celebrate your review with our entire crew. It's an honor to receive your highest score. We will continue to grow and will strive to impress again and again.Thank you. remember to look for the Crowne Plaza Fullerton-Anaheim when you return. We launch on May 1st. Thank you again "A Great Hotel for Disneyland!". We really do appreciate your business and your review. Have a great Spring and we will see you next time! Tommy

Summary Heading: Good thing this hotel changed owners. It was for the better.
Summary: I've stayed here several times. This hotel used to be part of a hotel chain until they sold the property. In any case they made some decent upgrades. The rooms are a tad small but they make it up for certain amenities like a more homey setting and cable tv.  Of all the times I've stayed here, the front desk is always busy even on weekdays. One time a man was handling a line of guests and all the calls that were coming in. He look flustered. They should hire more staff for the front.  They have a store that opens late; I think til 11 pm. You can also come chill at the bar and watch some tv or have a meal at the restaurant next door.  Sometimes you can get a room here through the hoteltonight app. You can score $25 off if you sign up using the code mrhee2.
Manager Response: Hello "Good Thing". This is a very nice review. Thank you. This is a very nice compliment. The new management team took the helm on November 1st and have been making improvements ever since. Thank you for noticing. We are completing another refresh now. We will become the Crowne Plaza Fullerton-Anaheim beginning May 1, 2014. There are many upgrades. Thank you for mentioning our Griswold Bar and Grill. It is a fabulous place to relax after a day at work or the amusement parks and indeed it is open until 11 PM with the flexibility to extend to 1:30 AM if demand dictates. We have a lot of fun there. Hotwire can save you some money it’s true but be careful please. The rooms through these channels are often limited and don't reflect the full offering of the hotel. Just do some research first to be sure you are looking at all options. Thanks again "Good Thing" We will keep working hard and we shall see you next time. Tommy

Summary Heading: Very nice with a few problems
Summary: We enjoyed our 3-day stay at this hotel; room was clean and comfortable although we would have appreciated a microwave in addition to the small refrigerator.  Lobby and central pool area were very nice, but many rooms are subject to traffic noise from the busy 91 freeway.  Rooms on the back of the hotel are quieter, but overlook a run-down industrial area...in fact the entire hotel is in a semi-industrial area and there are really no restaurants within walking distance.  Conveniently located for driving to most Orange County attractions, however.    Our room, on the 5th floor, had a connecting door to the next room.  This became a minor problem on the second night of our stay, when a couple with an infant moved in...connecting door was not sufficiently insulated to block the
Manager Response: "Very Nice". Thank you. It’s true that the rooms in the tower are more quite although the other windows are tripled pained and have a noise dampening curtain. We don’t get many negative comments about the noise but for very light sleepers it could make a difference. I met with my Chief Engineer today after reading your comment. I believe there is an opportunity to add, repair or replace the existing noise / "weather" striping that is in place now and to adjust the connecting doors to eliminate gaps at the base. We are an all concrete building so making these improvements should correct the connecting door noise issue. Thank you for your help.  We are not in walking distance to local restaurants but we do offer a complimentary shuttle to and from anywhere within 7 miles of the hotel including Disney, Knotts and or course Downtown Fullerton and Disney which have endless choices. Nobody walks in LA and no one wants to drive…. Thank you for your review and be sure to look for the Crowe Plaza Fullerton-Anaheim when you return. Tommy

Summary: Great Hotel, would recommend it to anyone. I purchased on Groupon and relied on reviews of others, that I read. I didn't try either of the two restaurants or room service. My only complaint was the lack of security in the hotel. I stayed in the tower so my door was inside the hotel. The back or side entrances of the hotel were never locked, as noted on the door they would be. The reason why this is a big deal to me is because I opted not to use their dry cleaning service, but to use the guest laundry instead. I had to wait over 20 minutes for someone, who left their clothes in the machines while the cycles ended (that is not the fault of the hotel). But, as she came in to check on her laundry, we started talking.... Truth behold, her friend lives at the hotel and she comes over
Manager Response: Hi Great Hotel. Thank you for the great review and the information. Thank you so much. I have already met with our security department which is on site 24 hours a day regarding timed door locks. They are there to control access and enhance security and must be engaged. The door in question has been added to the nightly rounds and will not be missed again. I am glad that you had a chance to utilize our laundry services. Many travelers actually will do laundry here and travel home with a suitcase full of clean cloths. I think that is pretty cool. I want everyone to know that no one lives at this hotel. I have no guests staying longer than 7 days and enforce check out policies to assure this never happens. Her boyfriend may have been a guest but certainly did not live here and we do check the laundry which is also key controlled. I am very happy to say that we are a very safe hotel and security has never been an issue. Knock on Wood...Thanks Great hotel. I will work to tighten this up so that all feel as safe as they are. Tommy

Summary: This hotel was a nice place to stay. My boyfriend and I planned a trip to Disneyland and stayed here for 5 nights it was very comfortable and clean. The shuttle to Disneyland was very easy and convenient. The only problem is the plumbing... :-/ Our toilet as well as a few other guests toilets were clogged, but other than that had a wonderful time and will return during our next Cali trip.
Manager Response: Thank you. Thank you. Thank you Very Good. Thank you for choosing to stay with us and Thank you  for sharing your Very Good experience. Remember to look for the Crowne Plaza Fullerton - Anaheim  when you return. We will be converting on May 1st and will have many new surprises. Thank you very much once again. Tommy

Summary Heading: Good value for the $, clean & plush atmosphere, relaxing stay!
Summary: Chose this hotel for the weekend of the NAMM conference at the Anaheim convention center to hang with pals who were visiting and/or performing.  Horrified by the rate-jacking in the immediate vicinity of the center (Econolodges and Travelodges going for just under $200 a night? PUHLEEZE!), I was thrilled to find an AAA rate of $118/nt. for this gem just three miles from the heart of the action.  (HFCC even offers a free shuttle to both the convention center and Disneyland, although we chose to drive ourselves, so I can't comment on that feature.)  The exterior of the property, with its earth-toned stucco, reminds me of a LaQuinta (far and away my favorite low-cost chain), but the interior was a bit more upscale, more along the lines of a Westin.  Indeed, they're converting to a
Manager Response: Good Value. Wow. What a review. Thank you. I will definitely use your comments as positive reinforcement and cause for celebration. I have taken note of your difficulties and will use to assist with further training. We do have improvements to make. Thank you again for your fair and accurate review. it will help a great deal during our journey to the top. We look forward to seeing you again next year for NAMM but would encourage you to book early as I believe the secret is getting out. Thank you so much. Tommy

Summary: I absolutely loved this hotel! It was very inexpensive but had a very nice pool, bar, restaurant, jacuzzi, gym, and rooms!  They even shuttled us FOR FREE to Disneyland which is about 10-15 minutes away.  The staff was very nice and I look forward to staying here another time.
Manager Response: Amazing Value. I could not have said it better. Your hired! Thank you. Reading your review makes me very happy and provides inspiration. I will share with my crew and celebrate together. Thank you very much and we look forward to hosting you on your next visit. Tommy

Summary: I stayed here last week and was pleased with the service and amenities this hotel has to offer.  Check in was pleasant, the front desk staff was nice and informative. The  pool and Hot Tub are well maintained.  This hotel is soo close to Disneyland and great eateries.  I paid 59 bucks a night thanks to a Groupon, what a steal!!  My husband just bought another Groupon offer and we plan to return this Friday.
Manager Response: Thank you What a Steal. Thank you for your very kind words We are working hard and its glad to hear that some of its working. We will see you Friday and will try to very hard to earn another Excellent Review. Thank you so much. Tommy

Summary Heading: Excellent hotel and food poor organization
Summary: When I walked into the hotel the I thought it was very nice. My room was not ready when I checked in so I went to Griswold and the staff there was amazing I will give them that. Food was really good and I was impressed by the service. They truly worked hard in the restaurant.  It took them an hour and a half to get my room ready past check in time. That was really hard on me because I had been traveling all day and wanted my room in to relax. Then in the morning all that was available was a 15 dollar breakfast buffet and the vending machine just happened to be out of order. So there wasn't much option then which was disappointing.
Manager Response: Thank you Excellent Hotel. I am very happy to hear that you enjoyed our Griswold Bar and Grill. I am always happy to hear about good food quality. Thank you. I am very sorry that you had a delay at check in. We guarantee check in at 3 pm. I will review to assure we are prepared for your arrival no later than 3 pm. Thank you again for the kind words. Remember that we will be completing our conversion to become a Crowne Plaza on May 1st, 2014 so there will be many new food and beverage choices. We hope to see you again next time. Tommy

Summary Heading: Too bad the service was awful
Summary: We got to the hotel on Thursday checked in (Front Desk was not the friendliest staff) we got to our room and it was HOT...we figured it was because the hot day do we left got back to the hotel late evening and it was still HOT...we asked for maintenance who was wonderful and stated the air conditioner was broken but they couldn't move us because they were sold out. Understandable well we got up at 8am (Friday) because the room was so HOT. We asked to change rooms but stated they couldn't because no one had checked out and we had to wait till 3pm!! They made us check out pack our stuff and they stored our luggage. I called the hotel around 11am to check if we can go back at noon and get our room before we got on to our day plans. The Front Desk was RUDE and stated it took them 2
Manager Response: Thanks too bad...This is the worst kind of review. Great facility and location with poor customer service. Everything you mention should have and will be in the future handled differently. I will use your comments as not only a training tool but also as a counseling tool. Poor service will not be tolerated. Please e-mail me at tommy.spencer@cpfullerton.com so that I ca learn more and make amends. I could not be more sorry but promise to make it right. Travelers reading this review please also take down my cell number. 310 935 6339. I can be reached 24 hours a day and would  request anyone experiencing difficulties at my hotel to reach out to me anytime. I promise I will correct it and you will be happy. Tommy Spencer

Summary Heading: Great Hotel, Works well for Disneyland Trip
Summary: My mother reserved this room through Groupon, so for what we paid it was an AMAZING value.   It is right off the highway, and some rooms face it so I could see there being noise, but we were on the first floor facing into the courtyard w/ pool and it was very quiet. Some of the hotel's other patrons weren't quiet but it's not like the hotel could control that.  Check-in was uneventful. The staff didn't really have a personality, but they were knowledgable enough to do their job quickly and answer any questions. Lobby was clean and spacious.  The room was a little on the smaller side with the beds, but our family of 4 (2 parents and 2 kids (22 & 5)) fit just fine. Bathroom was fine, good water pressure. Beds were pretty comfortable, only downside is the room had two full size
Manager Response: Hello Great Hotel...Thank you for the wonderful review. I will share your comments with my crew and will use it as positive reinforcement. Thank you again and we will look forward to seeing you during your next visit to Fullerton-Anaheim. Tommy

Summary: Renovated, clean, quiet. Perfect location to get on the freeways. No complimentary breakfast but full breakfast avail for $15.00. If your booking was done through a 3rd party partner, call the hotel directly to confirm that they have the reservation. If not talk to the GM, Tommy, who was very helpful.
Manager Response: Thanks Great Location. I appreciate your comments very much and what you say is true. If anyone has any trouble of any kind I am the General Manager and am available 24 hours a day to assist. We do have a great location that is for sure. Just minutes from everywhere and we provide a complimentary shuttle within 5 miles of the hotel so if you fly in we can still get you around town. Thank you so much. I look forward to seeing you again next time.

Summary: Stayed two nights and we were in room 310. Tuesday night was $149 and Wednesday night was $89. Don't be fooled - this is what most people would characterize as a motel. You have to go outside to gain access to your room. Pros: They let us clock in early. Also, it's right off the freeway. There's an elevator. Cons: It's right off the freeway and right next to the train tracks. You can hear every loogie hock and conversation from anyone walking past your room - there is no sound barrier.  There is no free breakfast (except on Saturday and Sunday). There is only one open restaurant and the place was dirty and it looked dirty. Who puts white vinyl booths and chairs in a high traffic area? I pulled out my chair one morning and it was covered with food - there was a French fry crammed
Manager Response: Hello This is a Motel. I am sorry that you had such a difficult time. While it is true that we are conveniently located near the freeway and a train track I feel I should let you know that the train tracks are sealed and have been for years. You may have passed a track on the way in but I can assure you it made no noise. I would also like to share that we do have both exterior and interior rooms. The choice can be yours based on availability. Families, Sports teams and youth groups love the  exterior corridors rooms which all have tripled pain glass for noise dampening. This allows guests to move freely from room to room or back and fourth from our incredible pool while the corporate or adult travelers without kids seem to prefer the full service feel of our tower complete with a wonderful Executive Lounge. I am sorry that the restaurant did not meat your expectations. The truth is that the location you are referring to is our bar area and was only being used while we renovate our full service restaurant RED. This will be complete soon and will be an incredible Asian fusion restaurant.  I am sorry that you did not enjoy your stay but do encourage you to check us out in the near future when we relaunch as the newly renovate Crowne Plaza Fullerton-Anaheim. Tommy

Summary Heading: Best Hotel Value I Have Found
Summary: I really can't believe this hotel was just $80. To me, an $80 hotel is very basic and is usually more of a motel style. This place felt more like a $125-$150 per night hotel.  Pros:  -Fantastic price -Nice lobby -Very clean -Modern rooms -Free parking -Free wifi  The only con I can list is that the close parking was very limited and the overflow lot backs up to this spooky-looking semi truck depot. Not a deal-breaker by any means, but I felt it was worth noting, mostly for females reading this review. I doubt they would want to park back there.
Manager Response: Thanks Best Value. I really appreciate  your review. We are fortunate to have such a wonderful facility with the ability to offer it for an occasion value. Keep your eyes peeled for future deals and we will see you next time possible when we are a Crowne Plaza. I appreciate your warning to other travelers as well. We should always be cautious when traveling alone and especially in parking lots. We are well lit and have 24 hour security but its always best to be safe. Thanks again and we will see you soon.

Summary: The Hotel Fullerton was a good choice for us for a quick Disneyland trip-- it's about a 10 minute drive to the park and they also offer a free shuttle every hour from 7AM to 11PM.  We were able to buy our tickets at the front desk, allowing us to avoid lines at the park.    The hotel itself is located just off the freeway-- meaning it was easily accessible, but there isn't much going on around the area.  We stayed in a room that wasn't in the tower (where I heard rooms are nicer)  so while most of the furnishings were modern and new, the bathroom showed a little wear and tear.  The major issue we had was that being right by the swimming pool, we were woken late at night by people talking loudly outside of our room and again early in the morning.    Breakfast and wifi not
Manager Response: Hi Good Choice. Thank you for taking the time to share. I think your comments are very kind and should help others make our hotel their choice. I appreciate that very much. The interior tower rooms are more quite. I hope we will be your choice when returning to Fullerton-Anaheim and will only request that if there are loud voices or any disturbance to please let our crew know and we can eliminate right away. Thank you again for your support. Tommy

Summary: If your in the Anaheim area, I'd consider starting here for your next visit. It's close to all the attractions and it's just west of the 57 and just north of the 91 freeways. So you can jump on the freeway and explore so cal. Rooms were clean and the beds were comfy. I stayed here for 1 night the 2nd week in December and there were a bunch of people in the pool having fun. Next time I need to stay in Fullerton/Anaheim I'll be back. 89 bucks for a Friday night. Well worth it .
Manager Response: none

Summary: Overall my stay was great. You can either face the freeway or a big lot with semi trucks, so if you don't mind the mild eyesore it's a-okay. Super convenient location, totally underpriced (not a bad thing), and modern amenities. Only thing I wish is that they were part of a rewards program (Stash, for example). I would recommend it!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Maybe "Very Good" is to much for them but they are definitely better than "average"
Summary: Very nice rooms, good swimming pool, stylish bar, delicious breakfasts, friendly staff, good location. What else should a " jet setting roamer" like myself want? I can recommend this place with pleasure to other people who will have to spend a night or 2 in Fullerton, CA.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: One of the best in the WORLD
Summary: The service delivered by the property's manager Stanley is indescribable. Having traveled the globe, the care and service Stanley provided has no equal. He went so above and beyond what people expect, I wish I wasn't in Chicago, just so I could enjoy a weekend at this hotel. The server at breakfast, and the gentleman who drove us around (who's names I never got) were amazing as well. They were attentive to every need, also went above and beyond. I truly cannot speak highly enough of everyone at this hotel, the service beats some of the best hotels in the world!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Orange County has no finer hotel
Summary: The Hotel Fullerton has been designated as the preferref lodiging facility for the California State University, Fullerton. You can find the Hotel Fullerton featured on the banner of the CSUF Alumni Prefereed Partner Program www.alumnipreferredpartners.org.  As a CSUF Preferred Partner you can bet the hotel has had rave reviews from the graduate community. I found that these great reviews were all warranted. The rooms were spacious, well appointed and quiet. The staff treated me as if I were royalty and made my stay perfect in everyway.  What I appreciated most of all was its location to the CSU campus, perfectly positioned to the university so that I could access it easily and within close vicinity to the amenities of down town Fullerton.  The room rates....well let's just say
Manager Response: none

Summary: The Hotel Fullerton was a lovely place to stay in for my daughter and myself. We stayed here for 4 nights in September - everything was so very clean and the reception staff most helpful. Because of its location the Hotel Fullerton offers a free shuttle service within a 5 mile radius so getting to and from Disneyland was hassle free. Top marks must go to Daniel one of the very helpful shuttle drivers. Daniel went out of his way to help us and even spent a lot of time ensuring we had tours sorted when we left to go up to Los Angeles. Well done Daniel you made our trip, thank you so very much. The town of Fullerton is a must for nightlife and restaurants take the time to go there and arrange for the hotel to pick you up when your ready to return.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I was allocated this hotel by a tour company and I was pleasantly surprised by how nice the hotel was. A major downside to this hotel is it's location. It is approx. 1 hour away from Downtown LA and no public transport nearby. Despite this, it is very close to Disneyland, so if this is the main purpose of your holiday to California, then this hotel is perfect. Ideal for families as there is a pool on site. The rooms were spacious and clean.  The hotel offers a complimentary shuttle which made it easy to get to a Walmart and the driver was friendly. The staff were helpful in terms of what's in the area (FYI - nothing). Free wifi is available to guests but not to those who are part of a group. I would suggest they offer free wifi in common areas.
Manager Response: Dear AnaRCV,  Thank you for taking the time to post your Review, we certainly acknowledge that being 26.05 miles from downtown LA can be a challenge for some guests. However, we’re glad to report that we also hear back that being centrally located and less than 9 miles from Disneyland, Knott’s Berry Farm, The Honda Center, Angel’s Stadium and Cal State Fullerton is a real plus for many travelers. Thanks again, Scott Seymore General Manager

Summary: We booked a night here through hotels.com.  When we arrived to the hotel my husband went to check in and they told him they had not received confirmation from hotels.com confirming our reservation and that we would have to wait until they did.  He came out and told me, and I was upset...it was a long day and 8:30 at night.  I went in and asked how long it would take and they said they didn't know but could take as long as 45 minutes!  I showed them my iphone which showed our hotels.com booking and our confirmation number and they still said there was nothing they could do.  This has never happened to me at any hotels I have stayed at before and I book often through hotels.com.  I'm thinking while it is a prepaid reservation, they still take my credit card for any incidentals!
Manager Response: melissaamie, I'm so very sorry you had this experience. We obviously need to re-train the staff on how to handle bookings that come through third parties that have yet to reach the Hotel.  The Protocol is, call the "Help Desk", ask them for the information and have them fax the reservation right away as the guest is waiting to check in. I will cover this again tomorrow morning with the Front Office Manager and the TEAM so that it doesn't happen again. My sincere apologies... Scott Seymore General Manager

Summary: Checked in at the hotel around 11:45pm after a long day of fun. When I had arrived, there was only 1 person working the counter. He was busy answering phone calls about an AC problem (I guess there was a blackout earlier). Nevertheless, he was helpful. After I checked in, I heard the guy tell others that the night has been all booked up.  I got to my room & I was pleased with the spacious and "clean" looking room. Then, my nightmare began. I went to the bathroom to take a shower & I noticed a silverfish bug on the floor behind the bathroom door. Then I took a shower & when I grabbed a towel, TWO more of those bugs fell out of it. THANK GOD I LOOKED AT THE TOWEL 1ST BEFORE WIPING MY FACE! I was so disgusted. Then, I went to lay down (super drained from my day of fun) & noticed
Manager Response: none

Summary: Our original hotel room somehow cancelled our reservation near Disneyland without notifying us! So, we scrambled and found Hotel Fullerton. We were treated so well and everyone at the hotel jumped through hoops to make our experience positive. I love their breakfast and their pool and the rooms are very clean. Would definitely stay here again!
Manager Response: none

Summary: We spent the last weekend at the Hotel Fullerton celebrating our sons wedding.  We had over 20 rooms filled with family and friends, everyone had a great time.  The reception hall is beautiful and they have a friendly helpful staff.  Would highly recommend this facility to anyone that wants to have a wedding reception.  When you have that many people staying in one place and no one has any complains that's AWESOME!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: I enjoyed my stay very very much.  The hotel is in a great location very clean very nice staff is just great I will return
Summary: This is Our second year having a function at Hotel Fullerton.  The place is always clean the bed very comfortable.  The staff is very very attentive to your needs.  In fact we will be having a New Years Eve party there.  That is how much we like Hotel Fullerton.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here with my son's baseball team. Great service particularly since the place was filled with 13 year old boys. The maids were prompt and our room was immaculate. The only thing is I wish they would have fixed the washing machine that was broken. There are two washers and dryers in their laundry and with everyone trying to wash uniforms it was a little nuts. Breakfast buffet was ample and they accommodated our early game times by serving the teams in a private area early. Hope we make it again next year, will definitely stay. Close to Skyzone for lots of trampoline fun as well.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I stay at this hotel often and it is always a great experience. I would say, always ask for a room in the Tower section, if available.  The rooms are a nice size and at night, you can see the Disney fireworks.  If there is an event on the weekend, it does get a little loud and parking then becomes a little challenging but overall great hotel!  Also, the Koby burger at the bar on the 1st floor is amazing!
Manager Response: none

Summary: I stayed in the hotel for more than 5 weeks as I needed to be near a relative that was very ill.  I have never met kinder staff who were so personable all of the time to me and helped me 100%.  When I did have time I sat at the pool which was peaceful and quiet.  Fantastic hotel and I will be going back as a 1st choice next time in that area.  The manager, night driver, receptionist staff were just the best
Manager Response: none

Summary: I took my  kids to disney land and spent the nights at hotel fullerton..my kids were so impressed by the hotel .great customer service.very professional team that knows what they are doing.we felt at home and i will reccommend your hotel to anybody going to los angeles..kudos...
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Beautiful stay and best service ever.
Summary: Hotel fullerton was not the place we intended to stay. We had a reservation in another hotel but their service was horrible. We were very frastrated.  A friend recommended hotel fullerton and we moved. It'S A GREAT PLACE TO BE. We truely enjoyed our stay for few days.
Manager Response: Thank you for your wonderful review about our staffs and hotel. It was our pleasure having you stayed at our hotel. Your review will be forward to all the staffs.  Once again, thank you making us part of your lodging need.   Sincerely,  Management

Summary Heading: Good Accomodations At A Reasonable Cost In Orange County
Summary: I stayed two nights at this hotel during a business trip to Fullerton and Orange, CA.  The property (which formerly was a Crown Plaza) appears to have been recently refreshed.  My room was spacious, comfortable, and clean. The free WiFi was good.  The hotel is conveniently located near the major freeways and is not far from Disneyland and Knott's Berry Farm.  The value for the price is very good; just don't expect a "happening" place.  Also, avoid the restaurant (although there's not much else to choose from in the immediate vicinity).  If your needs are like mine (for good accommodations at a reasonable price), I highly recommend the Hotel Fullerton.
Manager Response: Thank you for the very detailed review. We appreciate the feedback and are able to use details given to help us continue to improve our services and amenities.   Sincerely,  Management

Summary Heading: Quiet and cosy place, if you can put up with the tour groups
Summary: We arrived in LA and stayed at the Crowne Plaza Fullerton from the 25th - 27th July 2012 on the first leg of our 16-day honeymoon in the US. Our first encounter was not the best, when we arrived at 8-9pm (we landed at 3.55pm) after a quick detour to one of many premium outlets, the registration desk (which was actually toward the middle/back part of the hotel) informed us that they didn't have our names registered, and later changed their tack to say that our rooms were given up to others, leaving us with the possibility of no rooms on our first honeymoon night!  I am usually a little concerned and careful about insisting for A room as hotels don't usually open up certain rooms for reasons best left unsaid. However, we were kinda stuck and they eventually opened up a room 101,
Manager Response: Thank you for the very detailed review. We appreciate the feedback and are able to use details giving to help us continue to improve our services and amenities.   Sincerely,  Management

Summary Heading: great stay for a few days of our lives...
Summary: Hotel fullerton was not the destined place of dwelling when we initiated our trip to Disneyland. Our son-in-law looked at packages and found this one  the day we arrived in So. Calif. It was amazing in several ways. The most important to us was the room itself: we were right next to the 91 freeway, but the room was so well insulated we did not hear the noise!! that was great and such a relief. we stayed on the west side, with the 91 facing us and no noise once we shut the door. Then there was the cleanliness and good organization of the room-it was at least 4star. Loved it. Also, we traveled with our daughter and son-in-law and seven kids, so we asked (the night we checked in!) if we could be close to them with their adjoining rooms. well, we were put right next door!  The
Manager Response: Thank you for your wonderful review about our staffs and hotel. It was our pleasure having you and your husband stayed at our hotel. Your review will be forward to all the staffs.  Once again, thank you making us part of your lodging need.   Sincerely,  Management

Summary: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Fullerton for three nights this past March.  The hotel has recently changed owners.  I believe the people who are now running the property are upgrading the hotel.  The rooms are comfortable and large.  Unfortunately, the hotel has exterior walkways which means there will more noise than you would expect from a four star property.  The location is good for those who want to be pretty close to Disneyland.  I would say it is within 15 minutes in good traffic.  Overall, we have little to complain about and would recommend the Hotel Fullerton.
Manager Response: Thank you! We love hearing great comments about our team here at The Hotel Fullerton.  Sincerely,  Management

Summary: This place was recommended by Hotwire as a 3 star hotel during a recent search of the Anaheim area, and it did not disappoint! The service alone was enough to bump the rating to 4.5 stars, and our hosts, Andy and Amanda, were amazingly friendly and efficient. I had called about a month early and asked for an especially quite spot and an early check-in, but the rooms weren't ready when we arrived. Those two took over and within about 15 minutes,I had two amazing rooms in the tower with every request filled and ready to go. Spacious beds, nice-sized, clean rooms, beautiful flat-screen TV's, and executive-level decor. The location is neighboring a freeway, so ask for a courtyard or tower room unless you're a hard sleeper. It's also a little off the beaten path, but close enough to
Manager Response: Thank you for your wonderful review about our staffs and hotel. It was our pleasure having you stayed at our hotel. Your review will be forward to all the staffs.  Once again, thank you for making us part of your lodging need.   Sincerely,  Management

Summary: The staff were very friendly and professional. Room was clean and there are plenty of things to do in the near by area. A rental car is recommended. The hotel bar is great., good happy hour specials on food and drinks. There is also a hotel shuttle.
Manager Response: Thank you! We love hearing great comments about our team here at The Hotel Fullerton.  Sincerely,  Management

Summary Heading: I would rather have rated it good, between very good and average.
Summary: Read the other reviews and some I agree with, some I don't. It is in a weird area, it is industrial. you definitely don't want to take a walk. I was in the tower so I had a view of the pool and courtyard. It was really quiet even though it is right next to the freeway, I slept like a baby and usually don't. I don't know if all the rooms have adjoining doors but ask for one that doesn't, I woke up at 5:30 with my next door neighbors wake up call, I actually thought it was my phone ringing. Nice staff, shout out to Amanda and Stanley at the front desk. They were beyond nice. One thing I really liked was the politeness of all staff I encountered. Didn't pay for my room so don't know value. It seems to be close to everything you would come to OC for. If there was a vrating between
Manager Response: Thank you for your wonderful review about our staffs and hotel. It was our pleasure having you stayed at our hotel. Your review will be forward to all the staffs.  Once again, thank you making us part of your lodging need.   Sincerely,  Management

Summary: This hotel was recommended by a dear friend and he was spot on.  The accommodations were excellent!  The purpose of our weekend stay was to visit a friend who served with my father in WWII.  Meeting at their home was inconvenient, so we basically stayed in a portion of the lobby by the side of the Bar, and I do mean we were there for most of Saturday and Sunday, pouring over photo albums, listening to my Dad's friend's stories, and laughing.  Not only were we welcomed to do this, the desk staff even brought us fruit-infused cold, fresh water from their lovely water jug at the front desk.  This was such a kind gesture!  We plan to come back next year and will definitely stay at this hotel.  It was a great experience.
Manager Response: Thank you! We love hearing great comments about our team here at The Hotel Fullerton.  Sincerely,  Management

Summary Heading: Don't like the layout/location but otherwise OK
Summary: The Hotel was Ok. I don't in general like the layout of romms opening on to an open outside corridor. The ground floor rooms in particular are open to the street which I would not like at all from a security view point. The room itself was fine, clean and spacious. Breakfast was standard buffet affair which was fine. The staff were very helpful. There was a bit of a rumpus one night in one of the nearby rooms which was a bit concerning. It was hard to find the hotel entrance, we drove past without realising. I'm not sure about the area in general seems a bit industrial ... I certainly wouldn't have gone for a walk. It's a short drive to Anaheim and if you are there to see Mickey then there's a shuttle bus.
Manager Response: Thank you for the very detailed review. We appreciate the feedback and are able to use details giving to help us continue to improve our services and amenities.   Sincerely,  Management

Summary: Room was good, but the breakfast really so so. Far away to everywhere except Disney. Beautiful swimming pool could be viewed from all corridors. Free wifi access provided. I really like the bed, looks like two double bed in room.
Manager Response: Thank you for the very detailed review. We appreciate the feedback and are able to use details giving to help us continue to improve our services and amenities.   Sincerely,  Management

Summary: I've stayed here when it was the Crowne Plaza and had hot water issues before.  Maybe the rooms in the tower have reliable hot water... those in the wings don't.   The woman at check in was overly chatty but not transactionally efficient.  Fitness room is decent.  The facility seems to cater mainly to Asian tour groups (always buses boarding).     Priceline says this is a 3.5 star, but it's does not deserve the ranking.
Manager Response: Thank you, EatlandMall for your review.  We do apologize that you had to experience inconveniences during your stay with us. Our goal is to provide quality service to all of our guests.  We tried our best to resolve all issues at the earliest convenience. Regarding the water, we have fixed and double verified that it’s running.    Once again, we sincerely apologize and thank you for sharing your concern.   Best Regards, Management

Summary: I arrived to check in before my husband and I came, I was greeted first of all by your Bellman, who just made me smile at his enthusiasm. After continuing in, I was greeted by Andy and Grace, what a fun front desk you have, professional, friendly and they laugh too!!! Very personable! (Most hotels they seem so solemn) Everything was handled within under 10 minutes! Fast and EXCELLENT customer service!  My husband and I returned and went to the room, very very clean and nicely upgraded. We then went down for dinner at Griswold bar and Grill, The server was terrific friendly and prompt! Our dinner was lovely, and I must compliment that the Chardonnay was well chilled, sometimes I go places and it isn't, We were so pleased! Loved the ambiance, even told my husband I would want a
Manager Response: Dear KismetFullerton,  Thank you for your wonderful review about our staffs and hotel.  It was our pleasure having you and your husband stayed at our hotel.  Your review will be forward to all the staffs.  Once again, thank you making us part of your lodging need.   Sincerely,  Management

Summary Heading: Very clean, but obviously a converted property
Summary: Not sure if all the rooms open to the outside, but I didn't notice any.  After seeing room doors on the exterior of the hotel from the front parking lot, I asked for a room on the interior of the hotel. The request was honored, but the 'interior' of the hotel opened up to the outdoors as well!  Slightly odd for a Crowne Plaza - but this property was obviously a different type of hotel at one time.  The exterior doors were only slightly unnerving, as the area seemed safe and the room was certainly clean with typical Crowne Plaza amenties.  I found it to be an adequate value hotel selection.  Expect to have an outdoor entry/exit room, however.
Manager Response: Dear Jsantivanez,  Thank you for making us part of your lodging need during your recent visit to Orange County.  We are glad that we have met your expectation during your stayed with us.  We appreciate your review.  Sincerely,  Management

Summary: My family and I stayed at this hotel for 6 nights and it was a gong show from start to finish.  We arrived around 9-10pm to check in and there were 3 people at the front desk, we asked about the cost of breakfast and each employee had a different answer, they couldn't agree or didn't know how much it cost and eventually one of them even told us that it would not be a good idea to eat breakfast there.  They had no idea about disneyland tickets and had to go to the disney website.  So, we said don't worry about it, we'll do it ourselves.  Anyways, the rooms were clean, but the toilet got plugged up 3 nights of the 6 that we were there.   There was not enough hot water for showers. For the first 3 nights, we kept asking housekeeping to make sure that there are 4 towels for each
Manager Response: Dear Painkilla71,  Thank you for your time in writing this review; it’s very helpful to us in knowing our guests view.  We will make to sure to forward this review to all our department managers and use this to re-train our staffs to ensure that other guests will not have to encounter the same issues.   Once again, thank you for sharing your thought with us and giving us an opportunity to improve our service.  Sincerely,  Management

Summary: We actually stayed here with friends for New Years for our trip to Disneyland which was only about 15 minutes away.     The room was really nice. They had a mini fridge that actually worked really well. The bed was really comfortable, and the bathroom was very nice.       The location wasnt bad either as it was a short drive for food or convenient store items. If visiting Disney again I would choose to stay here. Good value for the price.
Manager Response: Thank you polish_princess82 for your amazing review regarding our room features.  We are glad that you had an incredible time at Disneyland with your family and friends.  For your next visit, don’t forget to utilize our complimentary shuttle service to Disneyland to by-pass the morning traffic and parking chaos.   Once again, thank you and hope to you see again.  Sincerely,  Management

Summary Heading: Good price for New Year's Eve
Summary: The hotel is about 4 miles from Disneyland, but they have intermittent shuttle service to and from Disneyland. Or you can take a short cab ride. We just wanted to stay in the area on New Year's Eve after a day of Disneyland. Nice updated rooms.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The rooms were clean, the beds were comfortable, internet connection was pretty slow. Our heater didn't work in our room. I realized that it didn't work at a pretty late hour, I called down to the desk, and within 2 minutes maintenance was knocking on my door. They had it working within 5 minutes. They also told us if there were any more problems, they could give us a portable heater for the night & repair ours the next morning. It wasn't necessary, but it was reassuring. We had the breakfast buffet the first day, but couldn't seem to drag the kids out of bed early enough to go any other day during our stay. The breakfast buffet was pretty decent.  This hotel seems like it is near nothing, but actually if you go a mile in either direction you can find pretty much everything you
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel isn't across the street from Disneyland, but it's about a 15 minute drive away, so it's still reasonably close. It was quite large with a central courtyard, and the rooms were spacious and well kept. The surrounding area didn't seem to have a whole lot, but it's also close to the highway so easily accessible.  My favorite part was the buffet breakfast. Usually, when I think of a buffet breakfast, there is a lot of food so the quality isn't all that great. However, at this hotel, there weren't as many choices, but I thought that all of the things that they served were actually pretty darn good. I actually kind of wanted to go back just to eat the food there again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This rating is more of a reflection of the IHG brand rather than this individual hotel, however i did experience an unpleasant stay at the Crowne Plaza Fullerton. I was traveling for business and since I am a Priority Club member I chose the Crowne Plaza in Fullerton for my stay.   It was approximately 3:00AM  and the fire alarm began to sound. After a couple of minutes and the alarm still going, i decided to evacuate my room. I proceeded to exit the building and after about 15 minutes we were advised of it being a false alarm and could return to our rooms. At this point i am pretty much awake but do my best to fall back asleep. I couldnt have been asleep for more than 30 minutes and what do you know the fire alarm begins to go back off! I complained the next morning to an
Manager Response: Dear ryan c,  Thank you for taking the time to relay your comments regarding our property.  I am sorry to hear that the service you received was unacceptable. We work diligently to ensure our facilities are well maintained and we try our best to provide not just good value, but comfortable, clean and friendly accommodations. I have sent you a private message in effort to obtain more information.  Sincerely,  Irish V. Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: My husbands friends were all looking for a hotel room in Anaheim since we were attending the Marine Corps Ball at Disneyland and they all split up and chose several different hotels. We stayed at this hotel rather than paying $50 more for a hotel 3 miles away. I gotta say when I pulled up I was not expecting it to look so sad looking but when we git inside and saw our room we were very impressed. It did in fact look like the website.  We got a King non smoking room with breakfast included. The room was so clean and smelled great. The sheets were perfectly white and the bathroom was impressive too. Attention to detail definitely came to mind. We even ordered room service,  the food... oh my goodness.. was better than most restaurants. We ordered a bottle of wine and it came with
Manager Response: none

Summary: Hotel was good value for the money.  The beds were awesome.  Rooms were a good size and were clean with all the necessary amenities.  Property area seemed a bit unkept, but it was the week-end.  Just a note to Disneyland travellers....the shuttle goes to the park at 9:00AM and comes back at 10:00PM.  The drive to the park is about 20 minutes and parking is $15 per day.  The drive can be a bit confusing after dark.
Manager Response: Dear Altagold,  Thank you for your review of the Crowne Plaza Fullerton, we appreciate your feedback and will work harder to improve the public areas more frequently. We hope you will think of us the next time you stay in Fullerton.  Sincerely, Management

Summary: I got married in Fullerton and had a block of rooms reserved at the Crowne Plaza Fullerton for our wedding guests, as well as the bridal party.  The sales manager Silvia was very easy to work with and extremely accommodating. The hotel is very nice, clean, and well-appointed with a beautiful courtyard that features a gazebo and pool/hot tub.  There's also a bar/grill that we kept open late for a post-wedding place to gather.  We hosted a Sunday brunch in one of the hotel's ballrooms -- a really nicely set-up buffet with breakfast, juice, coffee, etc.  The staff of the hotel was very helpful and friendly, and they even arranged a free shuttle to and from our wedding venue.  The only drawback of this place is that it's right beside the freeway, so there's quite a bit of noise when
Manager Response: Dear Amy R,  It was an absolute pleasure hosting you and your wedding party. We are thrilled to hear that our staff was helpful to you before and during your stay. We hope to see you again in the future and wish you and your husband all the best!  Sincerely, Management

Summary: I just checked in tonight and i was Amazed by their services. There was this guy, Adam Agualar i think that helped us from the start. He helped with our luggage, then we talked and joked and felt awesome while we checked in, then he helped us with information about internet, where to eat cheap and good in the morning, he arranged our shuttle for the airport...he personally came with us to our room and helped us to get there faster. I mean, he is awesome, like an angel to us. Sometimes a single person can totally make your day, and he did ours!
Manager Response: Dear Rosiwtha M,  We are so happy to hear that our staff member Adam was such a help to you during your stay. It is one of our greatest joys as customer service professionals to know we have exceeded our guest's expectations.   Sincerely, Management

Summary Heading: Not Up to a Three Star Value
Summary: I stayed one night for an event being held in the ballroom. Check in time was 3 pm; the room was not ready at 3 pm. They sent us to a "Guest Lobby" with a TV to wait. They had coffee, and water but only 3 cups. There was no sugar or no creamer and no attendant. When the room was finally ready, the first thing I notice, upon walking in, was the awful chemical odor from the cleaning solutions used to clean the room. It was reminiscent of the $29.99 rooms on the truck routes in the remote areas of the country.  I coughed when I entered the room and the whole night. The bathtub had mold in the corners, and the tile on the floor under the sink was white, but where you walked was black. The carpet had gum in it. The pool plaster or paint was flacking off and the spa water was cloudy.
Manager Response: Dear IJustLovie2travel, Thank you for your review. We are disappointed to hear that our hotel did not fully fit your needs. We will be reviewing your input at our next staff meeting in order to better improve our services to our guests. If you are traveling to the Fullerton area again we would love another chance to show you how dedicated we are to servicing our guests. Please feel free to contact the hotel and ask for the manager on duty so that we may personally handle your next visit.  Sincerely, Crowne Plaza Fullerton

Summary Heading: Adam A. at the front desk was extremely helpful!
Summary: Adam Aguilar at the front desk went out of his way to help us with the many arrangements needed for our daughter's wedding.  He knows how to trouble shoot and think outside the box to help the guests of the hotels.  So refreshing to work with someone who exemplifies great customer service!!
Manager Response: Dear NancyHeld,  Thank you for the review.  Our staffs are here to help.  It is a wonderful thing that our staff had met your service expectation and made your stay a wonderful one.  Your message will be forward to the agent for his service.     Thank you,  Management

Summary: I felt very relaxed and comfortable during my stay. The rooms were spacious, the beds were extremely comfortable, and I felt like it was my home away from home. Most important, the staff was so hospitable and accommodating. One in particular named Adam Aguilar, was always available to address any questions or concerns I might have had. I was so amazed by his genuine attentiveness, and really reminded me why I keep wanting to return  back to the Crowne Plaza in Fullerton.!
Manager Response: Dear Andria,  Thank you for taking the time to recognize our staff member Adam. We love to hear when our staff has done an exceptional job, and we are happy to be able to pass the message along to him and recognize him here at the hotel as well.  Sincerely, Management

Summary: We stayed here for 8 nights and it was the perfect location for our trip.  We were here for the 2012 13u Pony World Series.  All of the teams stayed here and we went through priceline grouping and were able to get a great rate of $99.00 a night with free breakfast & parking.  We checked in on Thursday and the following Wednesday the team checked out.  We stayed until Friday and planned on checking out & moving to a hotel closer to the beach.  But, the hotel was about 25 miles to everywhere we wanted to go.  I asked the hotel if we could extend our stay for the same rate.  They let us stay for the $99.00/night.  The room was VERY comfortable and clean.  The Griswold restaurant was great.  We ate there a couple of times while we were there.  The boys ate there a few different
Manager Response: Dear baseballmom11,  We had so much fun hosting the teams and their families during the Pony Series, glad to hear you enjoyed staying with us! Thank you for also bringing up a few points of service that we can review with our staff members. To address your concerns about the credit cards, we did launch an investigation to ensure our system security. Nothing has been found to be compromised, however we did alert our merchants to be aware of situation.  Thank you again for your feedback, we hope to see you and your team again!  Sincerely,  Management

Summary: We have stayed at hotels with comparable amenities at considerable less cost. There was no continental breakfast available. There was a fee for Internet/WiFi unless you qualified for waiver. We encountered problems with the vending machines. And, the absolute worst was the 2-inch roach found nesting amid drying swimwear. While the staff was gracious and helpful when confronted, it was frustrating to constantly find ourselves having to seek them out, when we really only wanted to be of no bother, and enjoy the "convenience".
Manager Response: Dear Deborah,  Thank you for writing about our hotel and your recent stay with us. We are pleased to hear our staff was helpful to you when you needed them, however we understand that you want to be relaxed and not have anything to worry about while on vacation.   Thank you again for your feedback.  Sincerely, Management

Summary: Check in was fine- saw the receptionist handling a very difficult Indian gentleman who was slightly deaf and complaining about something or other. Room was fine and very comfortable- air conditioning wasn't great- the type that is individually located to the outside via the outer wall. Dinner in small restaurant was quite nice- but not haute cuisine. Location of his hotel was also good. Breakfast in Chinese-themed restaurant was good- I left my voucher for breakfast in my room, not realising that this is vital to obtain breakfast. Anyway, the waiter kindly found me another and all was well. Would stay here again. Staff all friendly and hard-working!
Manager Response: Dear Custardx,  Thank you for sharing your positive experience on TripAdvisor. As a customer service professional, there is nothing better than receiving kind words from a valued guest.  Sincerely, Management

Summary Heading: Starting point for national park trip!
Summary: Arrived to Fullerton via Amtrak. First time there. Went to get cab to hotel and the cabbie said "why pay me, when you can call the hotel formfree shuttle pickup?" we did just that. What a nice welcome to Fullerton! Hotel was nice with pool and laundry facility. Restaurant was passable.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of The Crowne Plaza Fullerton. We hope that the rest of your trip through the national parks was as successful as your stay at our hotel was.  Sincerely, The Crowne Plaza Fullerton Staff

Summary: This Is A Very Nice Hotel. Check In Was Easy And Had A Very Friendly Staff Member Adam A. Who Made Me Feel More Than Welcome To Stay . They Have A Wonderful Bar Also. The Room Was Very Clean And Open. I Will Definitly Stay Here Again !
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of our hotel. We are very pleased to hear that our agent Adam was able to make your stay more enjoyable. We look forward to hosting you in the future.

Summary: This hotel is an excellent value.  For the price of a lower end hotel you get to stay a very comfortable well appointed hotel.  We stayed on the "back side" away from the highway and enjoyed a beautiful sunset over the mountains while standing on the balcony.  The room was very clean and the extra cot we ordered upon arrival was at the room shortly after we got to the room.  The staff at the front desk was very cheerful and helpful despite being very busy.  We also enjoyed an evening at the lounge bar which had a very good seclection of adult beverages.
Manager Response: Thank you for providing our hotel with feedback. We are very happy to hear you enjoyed the sunset and our lounge. We hope to see you again in the future!

Summary: The location is probably best for business travelers. It's clearly an old property that went through an upgrade of mediocre quality a decade ago. I was here for a party and I didn't feel entirely safe walking from my room across the courtyard and into the banquet room. The bed was not all together uncomfortable. The breakfast was fine. I didn't have to deal with desk staff.
Manager Response: Thank you for providing feedback about your stay in January at our hotel. We are sorry to hear that your stay was not comfortable. If you plan to visit the area please feel free to contact our hotel directly and ask for the Front Office Manager so that we may personally handle your reservation.

Summary: Front desk outstanding.  Very accommodating.  Quiet surroundings..
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your positive experience on TripAdvisor. As a customer service professional, there is nothing better than receiving kind words from a valued guest.  Sincerely, Management

Summary: I rarely choose ICH as my preferred business hotel chain. But my normal hotel was sold out one week and I found a good deal on this hotel. While centered more towards tourists, this was an excellent business hotel. Friendly staff, easy check-in, great bar and restaurant and super fast Internet speeds. I'd highly reccomend this as an affordable and convenient hotel for a road warrior business traveler such as myself. Is not often a hotel does a great job accommodating both tourists and business travelers and this is a model for how it's done!
Manager Response: none

Summary: We chose this hotel because of the proximity to Disneyland. The hotel lobby and other public areas were well kept, but the building in which our room was located was atrocious. The corridors were uneven and the carpeting was dirty. I made my reservation through Priceline, which had given it a 3.5 star rating. Having stayed in other hotels with this rating, I can say emphatically that this hotel does not deserve above a 1 star rating. The location is offers nothing to the traveler, and we felt the need to make sure we were in before sunset. To made matters more interesting, on our first night the police appeared to take a man into custody on the hotel premises. This involved a police helicopter and about 20 patrol vehicles. The hotel never even bothered to contact us to assure us
Manager Response: We are sorry to hear that your stay with us was not a pleasant experience for you. We are also disappointed to hear that you were not reassured by our staff that at no time were any of guests safety compromised by the unfortunate incident in our parking lot. However we are pleased to say that through feedback such as yours we have extended our shuttle hours during the summer season so that more of our guests can enjoy the fireworks that Disneyland displays. We sincerely appreciate your feedback and hope that in the future we may have the chance to show you and your family that we strive to make each guests stay a pleasant one.

Summary: First time stay.  Room was very nice and clean with comfy bed and 42" flat screen TV and fridge.  Free shuttle to Disneyland.  The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful.  We will stay there again.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your positive experience on TripAdvisor. As a customer service professional, there is nothing better than receiving kind words from a valued guest.  Sincerely, Management

Summary: I've always had good luck with priceline name your own price, but not this time.  I selected a 3.5 star hotel on Priceline and this clearly was not.  When I turned into the parking lot I felt like I was turning into a trucking warehouse.  The view for this hotel is one of the busiest freeways in California.  The front desk person seemed annoyed when I asked him any questions and was completely unwelcoming.  There was only one person in front of us when we checked in but it took him 30 minutes to get to us.  The rooms here are closer to a motel then a hotel.  The bathroom was so small that I couldn't leave the bathroom door open when I gave my daughter a bath.  Then when I went to use the blow dryer provided by the hotel, all of the power in our room shorted out.  I called the
Manager Response: Dear corpratemomma,  Thank you for taking the time to review our property. We strive to provide our guests with the best experience while staying with us. I am deeply sorry that your stay with us was less than satisfactory. We apologize for the inconvenience you have experienced regarding the room amenities and hotel staff services you received. The feedback we receive from our valued guests, like you, enables us to target problem areas and take the necessary actions to ensure similar situations can be avoided in the future. We appreciate the candid feedback we receive and welcome any opportunity to improve.  Thank you again for your review. If there is anything we can do to make your next stay more comfortable, please do not hesitate to ask the Manager on Duty.  Sincerely,  Zelyn N Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: We were visiting friends in Anaheim and this hotel was the closest one.  It's an older hotel but it's renovated.  It's also a conference center and that made noise for us when we were trying to sleep.  I booked a very good deal with the Entertainment card and they gave me a room on the 4th floor near the elevator.  I asked if there was another double room not close to the elevator and the reception told me this was the only double.  I found that hard to believe but she assured me that it would be quite.  It wasn't. There were young conventioneers walking through the hallways at late hours on the way to their rooms, talking loudly. This woke me up a few times.  Also right outside our room was some sort of cement company or the like that made a lot of noise in the morning. There
Manager Response: Dear NJgirlonthego,  Thank you for your review and comments on your recent stayed with us.  We do want to apologize for any inconveniences that you had during your stayed, especially, the noise on the 4th floor.  4th floor is our designated Quiet Zone.  We will look into the noise issue on this floor.  Thank you for bringing this to our attention.     Our restaurant offers breakfast buffet from 6am to 930am for $13.95 per person and breakfast A La Carte from 6am to 11am. We do have packages deal that includes breakfast.    Breakfast is one of our local extra that we offered to certain level of Priority Club members.  However, our local extras do change from time to time.  Therefore, breakfast is not a guarantee local extra that priority club members get when they stay with us. We do apologize for the confusion.   Once again, we apologize for all the inconveniences and thank you for your review.    Sincerely, Management

Summary: Fairly good hotel.. Check in and check out was a breeze, came in late at night and left early in the morning. requested a pool view room so the noise from the freeway is not a problem once your hotel room door is shut. Room was modern looking and very sleek and excellent. TV was good, better than other hotels we stayed. Bathroom was alright. There is so much closet space. There is a small fridge,coffee machine in the room as well. The staff was nice. We had to pay extra for internet though but if you sign up for their loyalty program which the front desk agent Theresa told us, in our case we have been staying in Crowne Plaza's for a long time, the second night of internet was free. Housekeeping stayover service was good, cleaned our room well. There was a free shuttle to
Manager Response: Dear heiressdren,   On behalf of the staffs, I would like to thank you for your review.  Especially, thank you for letting us have the opportunity to make your trip to Southern California a memorable one.    Sincerely,  GM

Summary: I'm back from a cold and dry northern state. This is the third time I stay at this hotel. Same front desk people check me in today, he takes only 2 minutes to check me in! The room is great and clean, I'm having the my dinner at their BAR. The steak is good, the price is OK.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your positive experience on TripAdvisor. As a customer service professional, there is nothing better than receiving kind words from a valued guest.  Sincerely, Management

Summary Heading: Plan to Pay Extra For Everything!
Summary: Arrived on business at the Crowne Plaza Fullerton for one night.  This hotel is located next to the 91 Freeway, a busy traffic artery in Orange County.  Be sure to request a pool view room or a room on the back if freeway noise bothers you.  Good luck escaping noise, though, as this property is close to railroad tracks and a heavy truck storage yard with sounds from both evident day and night.     The exterior of the hotel looks dated.  The parking lot is large with free parking.  Check in took longer than normal with a staff member who seemed to be new and was unfamiliar with the hotel's computer system.  The lobby is small and uneventful.     My room was clean and modern with a bed that was average in comfort.  Bathrooms are small.  The television was large with a wonderful
Manager Response: Dear garysmith67,   On behalf of the staff, I would like to thank you for your review.  We would also like to apologize for the experience you had with us.   Moreover, we apologize for the miscommunication regarding our fitness facility and our executive lounge.  Our fitness center is accessible to all guests.  It is locate near the pool in the courtyard and is open 24 hours with room key access.  The executive lounge is located on the Executive 6th floor which is open from Monday to Thursday from 6pm to 7pm for Manger’s Reception.    We do understand different property offer different amenities such as complimentary business center and more.  However, for our guest’s personal privacy and security reason, our business center computers are equipped with Auto Wipe Function.  What Auto Wipe Function does is that at the end of each usage, personal information that guest left such as cookies and data will be deleted to protect our guest.    USA Today newspapers are available for guest from Monday – Friday only.  We do not deliver newspaper to all guests’ room.  We apologize that we fell short that day and thank you for bringing this to our attention.    Thank you for your review and we appreciate every comment and review we receive from our guest.    Regards, GM

Summary: The staff at this property were helpful under the circumstances. However, they were understaffed. We were locked out of our room twice due to bad keys. When we had to have our room rekeyed at 11:30 at night we had to wait in the lobby for 45 minutes in line. Yes, there are indeed people checking in at 11:30 at night with ONE staff member there. He was hard working, but just ONE staff member is NOT enough for a property this size.   The room was nice, and the bed and pillow was outstanding. Housekeeping did not refill the coffee used on the first day, but overall was acceptable. The back door leading to the unmonitored and somewhat unlit parking lot (it is not in the best area of Orange County) was NEVER locked, next to the sign that said "This door will be locked 24 hours a
Manager Response: Dear KI,  Thank you for your valuable review.  I do want to apologize sincerely for all the inconvenience that you’ve encountered during your stay with us. Managements will look into this and make sure this does not happen in the future.  Once again, thank you for your review.    Sincerely, General Manager

Summary: I stay at the Crown Plaza in Fullerton every chance I get.  It is far enough away from the crowded Disney area and only minuets to get there.  The hotel is clean, nice pool area and the staff very friendly and accomidating.  Good choice for families.
Manager Response: Dear Wildwilly1,  Thank you for your review.  We are glad that you had considered our property when you are in the area.  Thank you for giving us a chance to be part of your lodging need.   Regards, GM

Summary: We made our reservation here based on expo west convention. Transportation was a joke. The hotel was not prepared and there is no concierge service for luggage when checking out.  The front end staff were miserable in their attitudes and service.  The van drivers were the best customer service.DO NOT STAY HERE
Manager Response: Dear Norcal2001,  Thank you for your review.  We value all comments and reviews from all of our guests. We apologize that our services did not meet your expectations during your visit.  We will take this review to the next level and make sure this will not happen again.    Once again, thank you for your review.    Sincerely, GM

Summary: The hotel itself is nice not alot of extras but the Smokimg rooms are a nice extra. The balcony is almost a thing of the past, nice to see you kept yours. The staff are all  great but there is one that stands out.i dont know if you know what a valuable employee you have in octavia at the front desk our not..she is not only capable and qualified but she beautiful inside and out.she anticipates my needs and she has never failed to have my needs met in a professional and courtious manner and always a smile for me. She knows me by name has my room ready.she is smart as a whip and could easily be snapped up by another employer..and your lucky to have her,so traeat hee well.your lucky to have her . Liaa
Manager Response: Dear Lisa S,  Thank you for your wonderful review about our staff.  We will forward the review to the agent.    Once again, thank you for letting us be part of your lodging need.   Best Regards, GM

Summary: My wife and I had a 5 night stay and had a wonderful experience. The staff was outstanding - everyone we encountered was very cordial and helpful. Plus, the bed was so comfortable, my wife wants to get a new mattress like theirs. The buffet breakfast was great each day. You can see the Disney fireworks from our balcony. The highway noise might bother some, but I did not think it was bad at all. Good lounge/bar area, and a very nice courtyard and pool to relax at.
Manager Response: Dear Hawkman50,  Thank you for staying with us during your last trip here to Southern California.  I am honored that our services met yours and your family expectations.  Hopefully in the near future, we will meet again.   Best Regards, GM

Summary Heading: We found this hotel to be family friendly, well situated, safe & very clean!
Summary: We stayed @ the Crown Plaza, Fullerton, California during our Family Disneyland vacation for 8 days. It was a clean, comfortable, safe & friendly hotel. We had our 2 grandsons(ages8 & 10), our son & daughter-in-law with us. There was always a smiling face no matter what we needed or asked. The staff  was helpful @ accommodating regardless of the time or requests. We will definitely stay at this hotel again!!
Manager Response: Dear Debbain,  Disneyland is known to be the happiest place on earth, and I can say that I am the happiest person at this property when I know that you and your family had a wonderful stay with us.  Thank you for your review.    Sincerely, GM

Summary: Property is in an industrial area next to the freeway. Once you're inside, though, the public areas are recently renovated. There's a nice bar after work hours. Restaurants did not seem to be open during two day stay, but I came and went at odd hours. Room was also renovated, and quiet. Good place to stay if you have local business.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The train line runs directly behind hotel and they run throughout the night honking the horn frequently.  We were woken at least 4 times during the night. I have Priority Club card but did not get a room on the club floors even though the hotel was apparently empty.  Only when I complained about not being in a club room did they give me free internet access.  The fitness room has no cleaner/disinfectant for use on the machines.  We would not stay here again.  A bad experience for our first ever visit to California.
Manager Response: Dear Chamcooker,  Thank you for taking the time to write your review. I do apologize for any inconvenience that you have experienced with the lack of disinfectant in the fitness room. I will follow up with the executive housekeeper to ensure that similar incidents won't happen again. Again, thank you for staying with us and we hope to serve you in the future.  Regards, Brenda J. IHGCare

Summary: It changed from my last vistit back to 3 months ago. The employees are now very very friendly. Thanks to Chris, Jeni. I stay here every other month and I found out the management company changed. The service is great, room is much clean. My company used to book me at Marriott but I like this one better, because the manager reception and Internet is free to corporate guests.
Manager Response: none

Summary: If you stay request a room that does not front the freeway.  Rooms are clean but they charge you extra for a single king bed!  One of the two phones in the room did not work.  Property is clean and there is plenty of free parking.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Decent hotel value, but don't expect much
Summary: hotel was within close vicinity to Disneyland.  Stay overnight for our family's short trip there. Check in late in the evening.  The front desk young lady checking us in was extremely courteous and helpful.  The hotel itself, besides from the restaurant and bar, seems outdated.  The room seems to old and the bathroom not so great but then again, that was acceptable for the price paid for the stay.  The restaurant and bar seems to have been modernized with TVs throughout the place showing different games.  Seems to have been more catered to individual business travelers.  Not that great but decent value with the location.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I check in a touch late, and the staff were accommodating and friendly for my tardiness...The room was fabulous. It had great furnishing. What i like that it had a hidden refrigerator cupboard so the actual refrigerator wasn't expose, so it wouldn't to off set the mood of the room.  The bed, by far had to be the most comfortable bed i have ever slept in. Had numerous pillows, more-so than your average person can handle which made sleeping that more comfortable. I slept forever, and genuinely got upset cause i lost half of my day because i was so relaxed...overlooking from the balcony, was the pool, and even though i didn't get the chance to swim in it, it look very sophisticated and modern.  The restaurants, had great food, and great staff to talk to and they were genuinely
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your positive experience on TripAdvisor. As a customer service professional, there is nothing better than receiving kind words from a valued guest.  Sincerely, Management

Summary: I was very happy with the level of everything in this hotel I did not expect to find something like that in Fullerton
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Be prepared to not get any rest
Summary: The room itself was acceptable, however, the noise ALL night was intolerable.  I just spent 4 nights there and really never slept.  They get in tour groups that party all night.  Horrible experience overall.  Refrigerator was broken; told them 3 times.  Never did get fixed.   Not recommended.  I am astounded that they have a 31/2 star rating; maybe worthy of a 2.
