Manager Response: Dear Valued guest,   We are happy to announce that we have made many changes to our hotel based on reviews such as yours. We hope that if you are traveling to the Fullerton Area again you will give us a second chance to show you how dedicated our staff is to our guests  Sincerely Management

Summary Heading: Not a great hotel if your wanting to relax.
Summary: We checked into the hotel early, which they were able to accomodate.  It went down hill from there.  Toilet in first room blocked on 2 occasions, and the connecting room door would not lock.  Reported this to reception on 3 occasions and they did not seem interested as it took someone over 2 hours to attend to resolve, and we were waiting to go out.  The iron did not work, and the aircon was VERY noisy!  We asked to move as were not happy, and the next room was even worse!  Stains on the sheets, aircon hanging off the wall and even noisier, tap in bath being held on by the sealent, no furniture on the heavily stained balcony carpet, marks all over the walls, stained chair and footrest, fridge smells of mold, cockroaches, strange stains on the wall in the bathroom......need I say
Manager Response: Dear Valued guest, We are happy to announce that we have made many changes to our hotel based on reviews such as yours. We hope that if you are traveling to the Fullerton Area again you will give us a second chance to show you how dedicated our staff is to our guests  Sincerely Management

Summary: I'm running out of good things to say about these Crowne Plazas.  This one was just like all the rest.  Clean, comfortable, good service.  You just can't go wrong!  Only problem...no breakfast!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Worst Crown Plaza I have ever been to
Summary: We recently stayed here for a family function in fullerton.  Reviews stated a four star, this was more like a three.  It was clean enough but very loud, lots of tourgroups in late out early.  Never heard the freeway as some reviews stated. Pool was nice.  Maid service allways seemed to run out of towels.  Rooms were dated, TV's old, my daughter found a cockroach in her room (gross) Staff was not exactlly what I would call friendly, I have never been to a Crown Plaza like this, Corp. should be embarressed with this facility.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayead two nights.  Had also stayed in January 2011 because it is convenient to family.  Convenient to Disneyland and other entertainment venues.  Located off the freeway but we never heard any freeway noise.  Very attractive.  Has excelent workout room with equipement in good condition.  We did not use the pool but it appeared to be very nice.  Pool is located in central area with lush landscaping around it.  Hotel has an Asian dining room and serves American food as well.  However during our stay the kitchens were being redone and only American food was available.  Nice cocktail lounge an bar area.  They offer breakfast for $10 if it is ordered the night before.  $15 in the morning.  We just drove a short way to a Subway and brought breakfast back.  There are no other
Manager Response: none

Summary: Pros:  Free parking, free internet, internet speed, freeway access, relatively clean, vending machines, staff service Cons:  Close to freeway noise, hallway noise and light thru the door, pool needs referb and better cleaning, lots of kids and tour buses, TV is 19 inch CRT, bed a bit hard for my liking, one night 5 crock pots of food in vending machine room smelling up the entire hallway?, fitness equip is beat, some carpet stains.
Manager Response: none

Summary: stayed 2 nights.  already knew it was right next to the 91 freeway. asked for and was given a room facing away from freeway.  freeway noise can still bounce off of the tower.  inside the room you could not hear the freeway traffic.  outside corridors not as bad as you might think.  wifi worked great.  any and all staff encountered were courteous and helpful.  had the free breakfast that was not bad at all; scrambled eggs, bacon/sausage, home fries, waffles or biscuit/gravy, fresh fruit, cereal, oatmeal).  the pool temperature was just right and size of pool is very decent.  a number of tables and chairs available poolside and makes for a great eating area if you get take-out food.  the exercise room is small and can be stifling if the a/c is not on already.  exercise room has a
Manager Response: none

Summary: Staff was very helpful. Wireless free but weak everywhere making it hard to work. Rooms clean and updated. Beds a 7 out of 10. VERY LOUD next to the freeway. Near Fullerton which had exceptional restaurants. ASK for the free buffet breakfast when you book.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Could not have been let down worse.
Summary: After calling ahead for my reservation and inquiring on the wake up call service, I arrived. Again advised both young ladies at the front desk i WOULD  NEED TWO WAKE UP CALLS AND THAT IT WOULD BE REQUIRED FOR ME TO ANSWER. I let the staff know I was going to be up late preparing  for the morning. I was assured this would be no problem and it would be done. Wake up calls were requested at 6:15am and 7:00am Raeann checked me in and was helping me, she again said she would see that my request was complied with. When I awoke the was no phone ringing, no message light on nothing. Needless to say I was late for my meeting. The only reason I stayed was for the live person wake up. Not good. I had cleared a late check out upon checking in. However I was interrupted seven times by
Manager Response: Dear Valued guest,  We are happy to announce that we have made many changes to our hotel based on reviews such as yours. We hope that if you are traveling to the Fullerton Area again you will give us a second chance to show you how dedicated our staff is to our guests    Sincerely Management

Summary Heading: Cramped room, small bathroom, a stone's throw from the 91 freeway (noise and all)
Summary: The room smelled like an old mattress.  The freeway was just off the outdoor hallway, which caused there to be CONSTANT obnoxious noise.  Check in was fine.  The staff was competent and friendly.  There were 2 or 3 people behind the desk…  The bathroom was super small, and needs updating.  Not terribly dirty, but we found some hairs.  Also, on the pillow, I found a small round bug.  (not sure what a bed bug looks like…  but???) Another person with our group found a roach on the wall.  Breakfast was $10 per person, and decent…  but for $10 each, we could have done better.  Parking was free and very convenient.  First night couldn’t find the switch for the Heater, so we were cold…  (Switch is in hallway, above mirror) All in all, I would recommend using hotwire or something, for
Manager Response: Dear Valued guest,  We are happy to announce that we have made many changes to our hotel based on reviews such as yours. We hope that if you are traveling to the Fullerton Area again you will give us a second chance to show you how dedicated our staff is to our guests    Sincerely Management

Summary Heading: Nice hotel but distance to Disneyland is difficult
Summary: This is a nice hotel - nice rooms etc but the distance to Disneyland is difficult. It means you need to get their shuttle (the shuttle drivers are nice but the traffic to Disneyland is terrible meaning the trip can take up to and over 30 mins then the pick up times are inflexible). Check in staff were able to find us a room early which was nice but they weren't very friendly and when I booked in for a shuttle for the next day they wrote it on the wrong day so we got up and ready then came downstairs to no shuttle around. Pretty annoying.  You would get a better standard of room here than walking distance to Disneyland for the price but you need to weigh up the convenience and flexibility.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: pleasant and comfortable stay while visiting friends
Summary: I was in Fullerton to visit an old friend and we spent a few days at the Crowne Plaza. It was clean, generally quiet (our room was right on an entrance walkway) and the staff were helpful. The room had free WiFi which worked flawlessly, a coffee pot and refrigerator. Fullerton is a short drive from Anaheim/Disneyland. There were lots of restaurants within a short drive but not within walking distance.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Our stay at this hotel started with a bang when we were given some complementary breakfast vouchers and a free room upgrade for our family of five at check in.  Even though the hotel is right by a noisy freeway, it was quiet in our room.  The children and I loved the hot tub and pool.  I enjoyed sitting in the courtyard every morning to read my Bible while enjoying a cigar.  Though the hot water was out for two days, it was fixed as fast as possible.  The breakfast buffet is so so and pricey but at least the children eat for free.  Hotel room service was excellent.  The one draw back was that you have to pay to use the internet in the business center.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: beware located in an industrial estate off the 91 freeway
Summary: if you dont have your own transport do not go here.we booked for 6 nights with thomas cook via netflights & asked for central location in LA,we were horrified when we arrived it was 45miles from tourist area in LA,approx an hours drive away with no public transport.we stuck it out for one night & asked the staff who were very unhelpful if they could transfer us to another crown plazza with no joy &told we would have to find alternate accomodation ourselves,which we did & private transfer to get there was $120.we were almost $600 out of pocket.to cap it all they even denied we had checked out the next day when they were contacted by netflights even though i had a letter signed by one of the staff to confirm we checked out early.very poor service we got.this hotel & location is
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Relaxed and friendly with taste and class. And at a very reasonable cost.
Summary: As a part of a large group, staying for a week, I had plenty of time to experience the amenities and service of this large and well run hotel. And also to hear my friends responses. The rooms which are well appointed are professionally serviced each day. The choice of in-house eating venues (restaurant, bistro or buffet) and the variety of meals is impressive. So is the large pool and outdoor areas. An unexpected test of service occured when I realized at the airport that I'd inadvertently left some belongings in an unchecked draw in my room. From back in Australia, with significant time differences, difficulties arose in tracking the items but with the intervention of Karmen Evans, the Front Office Manager, I was grateful and impressed that my items were promptly, very
Manager Response: none

Summary: When I approached the front desk, I recognized Raeanne immediately. She had been very friendly and helpful on our last visit to the hotel. Even before I could tell her who I was, she recognized me! I hadn't been there in 4 months, and she remembered my father who had been traveling with me as well. I was completely blown away. She deserves recognition and a bonus for making us feel so welcome. My daughter lives just a few blocks away and had a baby in June. We stay at the Crowne Plaza Fullerton when we need a hotel in the neighborhood, and have recommended it for our family members who come to visit. Raeanne is a big reason for our good reviews.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your positive experience on TripAdvisor. As a customer service professional, there is nothing better than receiving kind words from a valued guest.  Sincerely, Management

Summary: From the front desk repersentatives to the resturant service staff,  you know Crowne Plaza Hotel Fullerton holds high standard services requirements.  I love the service and I enjoy the food -especially their new menu - high quality Chinese cuisine....so delicious !!!
Manager Response: none

Summary: One of the truely unique things is the Executive Lounge which hosts a reception for Platinum and Gold members.  It must ne the way it's set up, because many people mingle.  Being constantly alone on business trips gets old.  That just doesn't have to be the case in this very friendly place.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: The staff at the Crowne Plaza were some of the most helpful staff I have encountered.
Summary: The hotel staff made this hotel stand out for me. From the shuttle driver to the maid, they put in extra effort to help me when I needed it.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Was treated as a valued guest. Nice room, breakfast was good.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel doensn't look like much, but the rooms are very clean, the staff very courteous, the food selection nice, and it is convenient to the fwy and other major routes. I would stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Hospitality, before and during the stay
Summary: This hotel and its personnel distinguish for the hospitality, before and during the stay. Especially Mr. Paul Kim has been our reference point to plan and chose the hotel.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Comfortable rooms and a great atmosphere
Summary: I frequently travel on business to Fullerton Cal. and always stay at the Crowne Plaza. the beds are very comfortable, the rooms nice and the amenities are great. It is also nice to be able to get a good meal without leaving the hotel.   As a business traveler, i also appreciate the free wireless and business center.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: One of the best Crowne Plazas that I've stayed at.
Summary: I enjoyed my stay at this Crowne. First of all, I got free breakfast coupons. Second, I requested a fridge and microwave in my own room and got both. The room was clean and nice. The staff was nice to deal with. They even sent packets of toothpaste up to my room several times when I asked for it. All at no extra charges of course. The pool looked nice too even though I didn't use it. I used the treadmills too in the morning, but I wouldn't say that the fitness center is adequate for more than just the treadmills. I went to a nearby gym for my workouts. However, that's about what I would expect from a hotel gym. I enjoyed my stay there. No complaints at all.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Does the job for a night
Summary: Stayed here for a night to attend an event the next day in the area.  The hotel itself was ok as was the room, but it was fairly loud with the sound of cars from the highway heard all night, making sleep difficult.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Quality hotel with high level service; free shuttle, discounted full breakfast, fitness and pool, dedicated service to disneyland.  Large rooms with confortable beds
Manager Response: none

Summary: I stay at  other hotel in Fullerton CA, 2 weeks ago,  not a good experience, I was very dispointed, room/ bed & bath was  small with one big old hard chair  that gave Mom's leg a big bump, so, this time I decide I got  to check it out in person, I walk in to front desk stand two nice lady staffs was friendly as I told them about my expeience & how  I want a good night sleep...both lady were kind & concern, they help me find a good room promised  I'll  be happy with Crowne Plaza, she even apology for my other hotel experience, so caring; " I love the room,  very clean,sure I had a good night sleep", I also took her advice to purchased my breakfast the night before & got a good deal  for 2,  overall, me and my daughter had a very nice experience, we are looking forward to go back

Any and all concerns that I had were addressed right away and the staff was always willing to help! Evening shuttle driver named Daniel went above and beyond the call of duty and should be commended by his superiors!!I personally would stay here again in the future!

She was the best person employed there. The rooms were spotless and the bed is so comfortable and airconditioning that works but a little noisy. The shower tap to the bath didnt turn on properly and had restricited shower water flow but called maintenance and they fixed it, very promt. The restaurant food was average. Summary Heading: I would go back here and recommend it to my friends and family.
Summary: No second thought. Best value for the price.  Especially the shuttle driver Daniel was very good to make a special trip at 11:30 PM beyond the last shuttle time.  Highly recommend.

Summary Heading: Free ear plugs and smelly rooms

We were told they would call me on my cell.  No call.  Next call to the front desk, no rooms to move us to.  They would try to "clean up the room".  Left and came back, no difference.  Next call to front desk was to Paul, and after I expressed my anger at the situation at least he moved us to a smaller room...right in front of the pool.  Nice and noisy and of course a place for the smokers to sit and smoke.  The next day no one at the front desk could help.  They told me I was lucky that Paul

Summary: We are Very VERY Pleased with the Quality and Service that we have received from the Crowne Plaza Fullerton. This will MOST DEFINATELY become our Hotel of Choice for all of our future trips to the So. Cal area. Thanks SO MUCH

Summary: We checked in around 6 pm guest services was very helpful we settled in our room and ordered room service, were offered complimentary dessert. Overall stay was amazing.

Summary Heading: This is an excellent Hotel w ith great staff, quiet rooms and good location.
Summary: I was recommended to this hotel by my daughter and son in law who reside across the freeway from the hotel.  My room was quiet although the door of the room was about 176 feet from the edge of a huge freeway.  Rooms were comforttable with good beds and a good ventilation system.  The staff was remarkable and responded appropriately to my requests..  Food and service in Restaurant was sub-par.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Beautifully appointed hotel with staff who aim to please
Summary: The hotel is easily accessible and near Disneyland.  We were able to see Disneyland's fireworks from our 6th floor room.  Beautiful garden courtyard was a nice place to relax with a cold drink and the pool is quite large and deep.  The staff are very accomodating and are clearly empowered to make your stay a pleasant one.  Special requests were met timely and with a smile.  I'll be back soon!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Crowne Plaza Fullerton truly feels like a home away from home
Summary: I am a travelling consultant who has been flying to orange county (from san francisco) and back for about 14 weeks now, and after trying several different hotels, found the Crowne Plaza Fullerton to be the best in it's class.   This was primarily for three reasons, the first and most important, it's staff. They are friendly, warm, and every time I fly in to this hotel, I don't feel constantly reminded that I am in a place that's not home. Second are it's rooms, they are full of amenities, and at it's price point, are the nicest by far and coziest (best bed).   Third, the quality of food in the hotel's restaurant. I would set it as a 24/25 (compared to how all the restaurants in the area have been rated) point rating in the zagat (ruby begonias/griswold), particularly the pricier

Because of Emily and Jaime i will return as a regular customer and recommend other guests to this property. Summary Heading: First time at this hotel and it was a good experience
Summary: We were in town with family for a wedding in Fullerton and the location was convenient for all travelers.  Rooms were very nice, restaurant staff very attentive, menu was rather limited, but good tasting, excellent breakfast buffet.  Nice bar and beautiful courtyard, but with limited seatning.   My only gripe was that specials were not explained to all family members and we had to get together to compare notes.  Front desk staff not consistent with service, which was disappointing.  Some got coupons, some heard of special deals, many knew nothing about them.  Hit or miss service and information sharing is not appreciated.  That said, if you ask specifically for any current offerings when you check in, you should enjoy your stay.  Also, they charge for use of the business center,

Summary Heading: Kudos to the Front Desk Staff
Summary: Surprisingly lackluster experience. I must commend the front desk manager for a wonder job. She allowed for my 'online opps' of booking a pre-paid for the wrong weekend, and assigned a great room with a great view in the tower building. Thanks Jenny. The hotel, however, was only average for a 3-star. Older complex with small-ish rooms and little closet space. The ice machines on all four floors were broken, and I had to go to another building to get ice (after going to the front desk to get guidance) For a Crown Plaza, I was a little disappointed in the quality. Being an preferred member, I have seen H.I and H.I.Express properties that were more plush and better appointed. The service from the lounge and the restaurant was only OK. The food was great !! Kudos to the chef.

Summary Heading: Comfortable rooms, Disney access shuttle, great price
Summary: Crowne-Plaza, Fullerton is right next to the freeway (81) and 2 miles West of 57. Super-easy to find.    Booked last minute for kid's Spring Break on recommendation from a friend. See many got this through Priceline and Hotwire for $60.00/night. I booked through internet   for $77.00/night which I thought was really good.   Rooms purchased through Priceline and Hotwire, face the freeway, be advised to ask for an upgrade. The tower rooms have only king beds (rollaway 10/night extra) and will be offered at $25.00/night. The courtyard rooms have 2 double beds (what we received).  Definitely noticed the freeway noise when getting out of the car, but never in our room, or  walking around the courtyard. Manager Response: none

Summary: I really enjoyed my stay. I was in town for a family trip to Disneyland. The hotel provided a shuttle to a from the Park. My room was spacious and quite. The staff was very friendly and helpful.

Summary: The staff was helpful, the food at the restaurant good (and they kept the kitchen open when I arrived just before closing at 11 PM).

Summary: I stayed two days on business. The hotel was very nice and the staff was excellent. I enjoyed eating in the lounge while watching basketball. I will stay here again the next time I am working in the area.

She said all the double beds were booked however she would offer me a free upgrade due to my "loyalty" to the hotel. Summary Heading: Great value for what you get.
Summary: I won this hotel for $40 a night on Priceline. I was going to Disneyland for the weekend and needed a place to stay.  I was actually hoping for a Fairfield Inn, but was upgraded from 2.5 to 3.5 stars.   I was worried about being so close to the freeway, but I was fortunate enough to be placed in the tower, away from the freeway.  I did not have to pay to upgrade either.  What is really great about this place is the free internet and free parking, which is surprising since almost every other hotel around charges for both.  The beds were really comfortable too, I fell right asleep.  I enrolled in the reward program and was even able to check out late.    I liked it enough that I tried to win it again, and I did.  I'll be coming here in a month.

Summary Heading: Relaxing Stay - wish we spent more time!

Plus they provided earplugs, eye masks and sound machines for super sensitive sleepers.  There was a very nice bar/lounge on the ground floor but we were too exhausted to partake.  We would definitely stay here again!

Summary Heading: Horrible Hotel, Charged $ TWICE for Unused Incidentals
Summary: First of all, this hotels is just average not worthy of its name.  I pricelined this hotel and when I checked in, I gave them my card for incidentals.  The next day when I left, I found out, my card was already charged $100 eventhough I didn't use anything in the room other than the bed. I had to take a 3 minute shower because the drain was plugged.  When I called to complain about the charge, they said they usually do that and they will give refund.  Guess what? The next day they had charged another $100 on my card and not refunded the first, so I had to call again and complain.  They wanted to call My bank to find out the problem. The problem was on Crown Plaza, not my bank.  Terrible, cheapo hotel. $9.95 for internet service!!!

Summary: I've stayed at the Crowne Plaza many times after our corporate contract people added it to a list of approved hotels.  I originally wanted to stay there for the Priority club points but now I wouldn't stay anywhere else.  The rooms are fine; I never had any trouble with road noise even though you're literally on top of hwy 91.  Breakfast is fantastic.  Staff is always helpful, and now the lounge is newly renovated and beautiful.  And to top it all off, it's not terribly expensive.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Good hotel choice, great beds & baths!
Summary: We had 2 double rooms on the 3rd floor, north side of the tower.  Some freeway noise and pool noise, but not bad. Our rooms were perfect, the beds were new and amazing. The shower/bath was clean, new tile and all shined up, good pressure and constant temperature.  The website advertised microwaves which was incorrect and according to management will be corrected by webstaff.  The in-room coffee & condiments were typical, nothing special. We did the breakfast plan and enjoyed a well-served breakfast in their restaurant.  Great coffee down there, fresh fruit and oatmeal bar was good, can order eggs (avoid the scrambled...) and meat and potatoes, juices from waitstaff.  All very nice, definitely a cut above the breakfast room buffets of hotels of same price range.  Front desk
Manager Response: none

Summary: The Crowne Plaza is a lovely hotel situated a few miles from Disneyland and a half hour drive to Newport Beach.  We stayed on a "Disney Package" which included park tickets and breakfast, and was excellent value.  The rooms were large and very well equipped; bathrooms were a decent size and linens, toiletries etc were of good quality.  There was some renovation work going on in the hotel but we were not disturbed by it in any way.  All the staff we met were polite and helpful.  Breakfast was good, with a wide selection of foods, regularly replenished.  We did not use the pool, but it looked clean and inviting.  The Disney shuttle runs every half hour and is very reliable.  All in all, we had an excellent stay and would definitely recommend it.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The hotel was in a perfect location for us.  The hotel is next to highway 91.  The road noise is very loud, however, we requested a room in the rear of the hotel, and the road noise was not a problem at all.  The rooms were well insulated for the outside noise; however, we were able to hear our neighbors.  Not just buffered noise, but entire phone conservations and television shows.  We only had loud neighbors for one night, so this really was not a problem.  We did have another neighbor knock on our wall in the middle of the night due to some snoring.  The staff were extremely friendly. We would stay here again.

There was no phone at the corridor. We had to walk all the way back to the lobby to get the new keys. The manager did not apologise for the wrong keys. With the new keys we made our way back to our room. This time, the keys worked but the room was already occupied. Nobody was in but his/her belongings were all over the room. We called the front desk. The manager did not believe that the room was occupied and sent the security guard up which was totally useless. After the security guard confirmed that the room was indeed occupied, we had to go back to the front desk again to be reassigned
Manager Response: none

Summary: I received a good rate on priceline. I grew up in the area and remember the hotel as pretty dumpy before it was a Crowne Plaza. I was a bit reluctant after winning the priceline bid but I was pleasantly surprised.  The hotel has been remodeled. I believe if you took the hotel and the rooms and put it on a nice beach somewhere it would be a five star. The staff was courteous and professional. The room was very nice, large, with comfortable beds. One nice touch was the little sleep packets they place on the bed. It contained an eye patch and ear plugs as well as some lavender scent. I have never seen this and I thought it was a great idea.  I didn;t have any meals there so can't comment on the food. The common areas were very clean and well maintained. Overall I was very pleased
Manager Response: none

Summary: My husband, myself, and my 3 month old daughter stayed here from 9/25-9/30/07 for my sister in-laws wedding. The room we got was very nice, it was clear they had recently  remodeled and they did a good job. Our room was in the building at the back of the property so it was away from the freeway noise and the building was very quiet.  The only complaint with the room was that the bed was a little hard even though it had a mattress topper it could only do so much to disguise it.    The front desk staff was nice, maintenance staff was prompt in responding when our toilet became clogged, and room service arrived in a timely manner.  All that being said, here comes the bad part of our stay. My sister in-law used the banquet facilities there for her reception-big mistake. The general
Manager Response: The guest has problem with the payment, and it is late, law requires us to close the banquet bar before certain time but they are not happy about it

Summary: I am a seasoned business traveler and I have a strong dedication to the Crowne Plaza brand. I travel to the Fullerton, CA area frequently and was excited to hear about the new Crowne Plaza in town. This property is fantastic! I was truly impressed by the staff and the property itself. It was clean, quiet, and classy. The staff was friendly and inviting, and the rooms were large and impeccably decorated. This property holds true to the Crowne Plaza standards I have become accustomed to, and they definitely have a repeat guest in me!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Check-in was smooth and we were greeted professionally by the front desk personnel....went very quick.  The room was beautiful and comfortable.  From the amenities to the fabulous breakfast....I wouldn't change a thing.  The Crowne Plaza in Fullerton will be our hotel of choice the next time we come to Southern California.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I travel to the area nearly every week and have a lot of hotels to choose from.  I have selected the Crown Plaza because of the excellent service, friendly atmosphere and the best breakfast I've found.  If you are platnum, you'll love the lounge.  Jim
Manager Response: none

Summary: I was totally amaze by this property and i travel quite offen, i was told by associates and family  that this is a must see so i took my family. And as i pulled up, there immediately was concierge to assist me and offer me any information for my stay, it was easy to see this was a place the employees enjoyed working and i was greeted and smiles it felt very comfortable and food absolutely delicious you must not miss the restaurant and the rooms are very clean and very comfortable i loved there sleep amenities and the room presentation is beautiful, the front desk staff explained the sleep amenities to me and i definitely wanted to try them and the lounge and pool were very easy to order from i will be back there i must say my friends were so right.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: This is the place to stay
Summary: Our Family stayed here for a family reunion of 37, and enjoyed every moment here, the staff was the best and the hotel's concierege was able to handle every detail we asked of him.  The rooms were so clean and comfortable that at times we just wanted to stay in longer and relax and take in our suroundings of our fantastic rooms. Now I dont know about you, but we had quite a few children here and when it came to dining at the hotels restaurant it was great the children loved the food and so did several generations.  We are going to recommend to all our friends and business associates that when visiting Fullerton Ca, or Southern Calif. this where they should stay to experience the best of resort stays for their vactions or business meetings and etc.  Once again Crowne Plaza
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your positive experience on TripAdvisor. As a customer service professional, there is nothing better than receiving kind words from a valued guest.  Sincerely, Management
